english.definition: The use of action to achieve a result
english.mnemonic: Action is him (activism) and his use of action always brings a result.
english.question: What is activism?

english.definition: The state of existing in reality
english.mnemonic: They thought he was lying, but the actual reality (actuality) was that his alien friend did exist.
english.question: What does actuality mean?

english.definition: Ability to make good Judgements and quick decisions
english.mnemonic: A queue of men (acumen) need good judgement to hit the urinal target.
english.question: What does "acumen" refer to?

english.definition: Sharp or severe in effect
english.mnemonic: A cute (acute) little dog had very sharp teeth that could do severe damage.
english.question: What does "acute" mean?

english.definition: Created or done for a particular purpose as and when needed.
english.mnemonic: She added hockey (ad hoc) to her list of sports, and the medical staff came on when needed.
english.question: What does "ad hoc" mean?

english.definition: Something done or repeated to a sickening and annoying degree
english.mnemonic: Add feeling nauseous in the tummy (Ad nauseam) and you can understand why the repetitive speech not only became sickening but annoying too.
english.question: What does "ad nauseam" mean?

english.definition: a wise saying; a traditional statement of truth
english.mnemonic: She took a dig ital (adage) picture each time she came across something that reminds her of a wise saying.
english.question: What is an adage?

english.definition: Confuse mentally; muddle; Become rotten
english.mnemonic: Add all (addle) the contents to the mix and you get a muddled and confused mess. The eggs were definitely off!
english.question: What does it mean to addle someone's mind?

english.definition: To stick firmly
english.mnemonic: Mobile phones seem to be added to the ear (adhere) as if they are stuck firmly.
english.question: What does it mean to adhere?

english.definition: Added information, something added to another thing but not essential
english.mnemonic: Add junk (adjunct). No! Please, no more additional things.
english.question: What does the term "adjunct" refer to in a sentence?

english.definition: An army, air force, or marine officer who deals with administration work for a senior officer.
english.mnemonic: The agitated ant (adjutant) sat next to the commanding officer annoyed that she had to do all of his administration because it was in such a mess.
english.question: What is an adjutant?

english.definition: Section of society easily influenced by advertising
english.mnemonic: Add masses (admass) of advertising and it works. People are easily swayed.
english.question: What does "admass" refer to in society?

english.definition: To tell someone they have done wrong firmly
english.mnemonic: Adding a monster punishment (admonish) when mum turns into a monster is another way to tell me off firmly.
english.question: What does it mean to admonish someone?

english.definition: To decorate and add beauty
english.mnemonic: At dawn (adorn) she adds makeup to make herself beautiful.
english.question: What does the term "adorn" mean?

english.definition: Clever or skilful
english.mnemonic: A droid did it! That's why it won all the chess games. These droids are so clever.
english.question: What does the term "adroit" mean?

english.definition: To make something weaker or of worse quality by adding another substance
english.mnemonic: You must be an adult to rate (adulterate) the purity of beer. It's checked in case another substance has been added to make it weaker or of worse quality.
english.question: What does it mean to adulterate a product?

english.definition: 1. The arrival of a notable person or thing. 2. Period of four weeks before Christmas.
english.mnemonic: Adverts for toys cause parents to vent (advent) their anger if they arrive on the telly more than four weeks before Christmas.
english.question: What is Advent?

english.definition: An enemy
english.mnemonic: They had the anniversary (adversary) of their divorce. Wow, did she hate him, and now thought of him as the enemy.
english.question: What is an adversary?

english.definition: A difficult or unpleasant situation; hardship
english.mnemonic: The advert for the city (adversity) made it seem like heaven, but in reality the people living there were in a difficult and unpleasant situation and were suffering hardships.
english.question: What is adversity?

english.definition: Act of supporting a cause or proposal; putting forward a case on someone else's behalf
english.mnemonic: Add four cakes (advocacy) and that's an act of supporting a cause.
english.question: What is advocacy?

english.definition: The protection, backing, or support of a particular person, or organisation
english.mnemonic: He just (aegis) wanted protection and support from the gang.
english.question: What does aegis mean?

english.definition: the science or practice of building or flying aircraft
english.mnemonic: As far as he is concerned he can fly an aero plane but it all comes to naught if you can't do tricks (aeronautics) - he wants to practise flying the aircraft to its limit.
english.question: What is aeronautics?

english.definition: Friendly, good-natured, and easy to talk to
english.mnemonic: To have a bull (affable) that is friendly, is handy.
english.question: What does "affable" mean?

english.definition: A written statement confirmed by oath
english.mnemonic: You will have a day of it (Affidavit) when you have to confirm by oath all of your written statements.
english.question: What is an affidavit?

english.definition: A liking, understanding, and feeling for someone or something; similarity of characteristics suggesting a relationship between people or things
english.mnemonic: He always wore a fin that fitted him to a T (affinity) but it wasn't until he met someone else with a fitted fin, that he found someone he liked.
english.question: What does affinity mean?

english.definition: stick, fasten or attach something to something else
english.mnemonic: Can you actually fix (affix) it instead of just sticking it back on?
english.question: What does it mean to affix something?

english.definition: A group fight in a public place that disturbs the peace.
english.mnemonic: Afraid? (affray) I'm not surprised. What a fight!
english.question: What is an affray?

english.definition: An action that causes offence.
english.mnemonic: A front door had insulting writing on it that caused offence to everyone who went through it.
english.question: What is an affront?

english.definition: Toward the back part of a ship
english.mnemonic: After (aft) feeling sick, she leant over the back of the ship.
english.question: What does the term "aft" mean on a ship?

english.definition: Upset and angry over being treated unfairly
english.mnemonic: A green ogre was perceived (aggrieved) to be a monster, but he was only upset and angry over being treated unfairly.
english.question: What does it mean to feel aggrieved?

english.definition: Someone who 'does not know' if God exists
english.mnemonic: She was in agony with her nostril after a tick (agnostic) bit it, but she didn't know if it was going to be serious or not.
english.question: What is an agnostic?

english.definition: The practice or work of farming
english.mnemonic: There's a grumpy culture (agriculture) among those who work in farming.
english.question: What is agriculture?

english.definition: A military officer who serves as a personal assistant to a senior officer
english.mnemonic: The junior officer aids the general when they go camping (aid-de-camp). His job is to assist him every day.
english.question: What is an Aide-De-Camp?

english.definition: An illness, typically a minor one.
english.mnemonic: Too much ale meant (ailment) he felt ill, but it's only minor; he'll feel better soon.
english.question: What is an ailment?

english.definition: Arm bent at the elbow and hands on hips
english.mnemonic: She always wore a kimono with a bright bow (akimbo) and walks around with her hands on her hips.
english.question: What does it mean when someone stands akimbo?

english.definition: Brisk and cheerful readiness; willingness; eagerness
english.mnemonic: A lack of a city (alacrity) meant they were all eager and cheerful about their trip to the countryside.
english.question: What does the term "alacrity" mean?

english.definition: Though
english.mnemonic: All bees think they are it (albeit), though only one can be the best.
english.question: What does "albeit" mean?

english.definition: Concerned with the transformation of matter, e.g., the changing of ordinary metals into gold
english.mnemonic: All the chemistry (alchemy) finally produced gold coins.
english.question: What was the ancient practice concerned with the transformation of matter, especially turning ordinary metals into gold?

english.definition: Financial support that a person is ordered to give their spouse during a separation or following a divorce
english.mnemonic: He has a love of money (alimony), but is ordered to give his spouse financial support after their separation.
english.question: What is alimony?

english.definition: To calm, put at rest
english.mnemonic: The alleyway (allay) was where she always went for a walk to calm down.
english.question: What does it mean to allay?

english.definition: Loyalty or commitment to a ruler, country, or group
english.mnemonic: A legion of ants (allegiance) all saluted and showed their loyalty to their leader.
english.question: What is allegiance?

english.definition: A union for mutual benefit
english.mnemonic: A lie down or a dance (alliance) with someone brings a union of mutual benefit.
english.question: What is an alliance?

english.definition: Hint at
english.mnemonic: She made a lude (allude) remark and her friend tried to hint at her to stop.
english.question: What does it mean to allude to something?

english.definition: Powerfully and mysteriously attractive or fascinating
english.mnemonic: I caught an alligator by luring (alluring) it into a trap which it found mysteriously attractive.
english.question: What does the term "alluring" mean?

english.definition: A reference intended to call something to mind without directly mentioning it
english.mnemonic: A strange illusion (allusion). I suppose it was a reference to a rabbit in a hat but that wasn't mentioned directly when the magician pulled a mouse from a shoe.
english.question: What is an allusion?

english.definition: A book published every year that includes information for that coming year such as sunrise, sunset, tides, and anniversaries.
english.mnemonic: The wise, old man had a knack (almanac) of working out all the sunrises, sunsets and tides coming up for that year, and wrote it all down in a book.
english.question: What is an almanac?

english.definition: distant and unfriendly
english.mnemonic: A loofah (aloof) is what he used to reach the most distant parts of his body.
english.question: What does the term "aloof" mean?

english.definition: A loud argument or disagreement
english.mnemonic: She wanted to alter their vacation (altercation) destination and he didn't so they had a loud argument.
english.question: What is an altercation?

english.definition: Putting others before yourself. Willingness to help others even if it has disadvantages for you.
english.mnemonic: It's all true (altruism) U comes before I. You comes before I is a truism.
english.question: What is altruism?

english.definition: A mixture
english.mnemonic: At a mall he bought gum (amalgam). There was such a mixture of different people there.
english.question: What is an amalgam?

english.definition: Combine or unite to form one organisation or structure
english.mnemonic: A group of mallard ducks and their gorilla mates (amalgamate) combined to form one organisation.
english.question: What does it mean to amalgamate?

english.definition: The character or atmosphere of a place
english.mnemonic: "Am I being rude to say that the silence (ambience) is ruining the atmosphere of this place? I came here to party, not read."
english.question: What does the term "ambience" refer to?

english.definition: Relating to the immediate surroundings of something.
english.mnemonic: I am so pleased the bees went (ambient) to explore the immediate surroundings of the garden as soon as I set the hive up.
english.question: What does ambient refer to?

english.definition: Contradictory feelings about something or someone.
english.mnemonic: The ambulance (ambivalence) went by trying a new siren. 'Yes No Yes No Yes No.' The people were unsure whether to like it or not.
english.question: What does ambivalence mean?

english.definition: Able to walk
english.mnemonic: The ambulance's story (ambulatory) is that it can walk.
english.question: What does ambulatory mean?

english.definition: A useful feature of a place available to those with access to it.
english.mnemonic: A man at ease (amenities) was found to feature in pictures of the town's school buildings, park, pool, and library.
english.question: What are amenities?

english.definition: An official pardon for people who have committed particular illegal acts
english.mnemonic: I know I am nasty (amnesty), but they still gave me an official pardon.
english.question: What is amnesty?

english.definition: Without a clearly defined shape or form
english.mnemonic: This was not a Morph to us (amorphous), this was a flat nondescript shape.
english.question: What does the term "amorphous" mean?

english.definition: A thing not appropriate to a time period
english.mnemonic: They had a knack for synchronism (anachronism) and marched in time with the other soldiers but they stood out as they were not appropriately dressed for the time period.
english.question: What is an anachronism?

english.definition: A word, phrase, or name formed by rearranging the letters of another.
english.mnemonic: "Tea and a gram (anagram) of sugar please, bad renter!" The bartender looked confused, but this person constantly rearranged the letters of words, phrases and names.
english.question: What is an anagram?

english.definition: Inability to feel pain or medication that relieves pain.
english.mnemonic: Strange that she had an allergy to freezers (analgesia) and yet couldn't feel pain.
english.question: What is analgesia?

english.definition: Measuring or representing information by means of physical, rather than digital properties.
english.mnemonic: And a log (analogue) can tell the time but my digital watch can't because the battery has run out.
english.question: What does analogue refer to in terms of measuring or representing information?

english.definition: To examine something methodically and in detail.
english.mnemonic: To gain an understanding of what lies (analyse) here, we need to examine the fossil methodically and in detail.
english.question: What does it mean to analyse something?

english.definition: Examining or liking to examine things in detail
english.mnemonic: An alligator has to be tickled (analytical) before being examined in detail.
english.question: What does it mean to be analytical?

english.definition: A state of disorder due to absence or non-recognition of government.
english.mnemonic: An ark is key (anarchy) to surviving if you have a flood, but it can soon get into a state of disorder if it isn't properly governed.
english.question: What is anarchy?

english.definition: Something that is strongly disliked
english.mnemonic: An athlete can't beat Ma (anathema): this is why Ma is so disliked by the other runner.
english.question: What does the term "anathema" refer to?

english.definition: The branch of science concerned with the study of the bodily structure of humans, animals, and other living organisms.
english.mnemonic: An atom isn't easy (anatomy) to see, but in the branch of science concerned with the study of bodily structure, scientists go into great detail.
english.question: What is anatomy?

english.definition: A short, often amusing story, especially about something someone had done
english.mnemonic: "While I'm tattooing a neck, don't (anecdote) move a muscle". The artist tattooed a short, amusing story across it.
english.question: What is an anecdote?

english.definition: Severe mental or physical pain or suffering
english.mnemonic: And then she squished (anguish) me and I felt pain and distress.
english.question: What is anguish?

english.definition: having angles or sharp corners
english.mnemonic: The angles were irregular (angular) on the sculpture, and it had lots of sharp corners.
english.question: What does it mean for an object to be described as angular?

english.definition: (of a substance) containing no water
english.mnemonic: The anti-hydrant protester is furious (anhydrous). He's made of a substance containing no water and wants all hydrants removed.
english.question: What does "anhydrous" mean?

english.definition: Make alive, Bring to life
english.mnemonic: And his mate (animate) could bring the monster to life.
english.question: What does it mean to animate something?

english.definition: Feeling of strong dislike or hatred
english.mnemonic: The animals and the moss in the city (animosity) created a place that humans hated.
english.question: What is animosity?

english.definition: 1. Hostility or ill feeling 2. Motivation to do something
english.mnemonic: The farm animals decided they must (animus) do something. They held ill feelings towards the farmer and were motivated to tie him up.
english.question: What does "animus" mean?

english.definition: to take possession of (something, especially areas of land or a country) usually by force
english.mnemonic: The ants next (annex) plan was to take possession of my land by force.
english.question: What does it mean to annex something?

english.definition: To add a short explanation/opinion to a text; to add notes to text or diagram.
english.mnemonic: A note taker (Annotate) keeps adding lots of notes.
english.question: What does it mean to annotate a text?

english.definition: A fixed sum of money paid to someone on a regular basis, usually for the rest of their life
english.mnemonic: A new city (annuity) is what they wanted her to move to, but she said: 'Only if you pay me for the rest of my life.'
english.question: What is an annuity?

english.definition: Declare the issue no longer exists
english.mnemonic: A nil value is a value given for the probability that dinosaurs exist. Basically they are saying dinosaurs no longer exist.
english.question: What does it mean to annul something?

english.definition: Ring shaped; forming a ring
english.mnemonic: Her annual lark was to wear a ring at the family Christmas party.
english.question: What does the term "annular" mean?

english.definition: 1. Smear or rub with holy water or oil, typically as part of a religious ceremony. 2. To officially or formally choose someone (to do something).
english.mnemonic: An ointment (anoint) was smeared on him as part of a religious ceremony. The person who put the ointment on was pushed forward to carry it out. His friends had chosen him.
english.question: What does it mean to anoint someone or something?

english.definition: Different from the usual. Deviating from what is standard or normal.
english.mnemonic: A normal house for us (anomalous) but different from everyone else's.
english.question: What does "anomalous" mean?

english.definition: Creature that resembles a human being
english.mnemonic: The animals are throwing a party, and it's not one to avoid (anthropoid). It's fancy dress, and you have to look like a human.
english.question: What is an anthropoid?

english.definition: Study of human beings, their societies and culture
english.mnemonic: They could use their hands to throw and when a mistake was made they would even give an apology (anthropology). It was so interesting to study human beings culture and the way they socialise.
english.question: What is anthropology?

english.definition: Foolish, outrageous or amusing behaviour
english.mnemonic: The ant's tactics (antics) were to distract his opponent with foolish, outrageous and amusing behaviour.
english.question: What does the term "antics" refer to?

english.definition: strong dislike
english.mnemonic: The ant tipped (antipathy) me upside down because she strongly disliked me.
english.question: What does the term "antipathy" mean?

english.definition: Old-fashioned or outdated
english.mnemonic: She was anti this quaint and outdated (antiquated) mode of transport. It was old fashioned and outdated.
english.question: What does the term "antiquated" mean?

english.definition: Keeping people of different races apart by law
english.mnemonic: The law wanted them to be apart until they died (apartheid) just because they were different races.
english.question: What was the system of keeping people of different races apart by law in South Africa called?

english.definition: A lack of interest or emotion.
english.mnemonic: A path (apathetic) leads to a robot that shows no emotion.
english.question: What does it mean to be apathetic?

english.definition: A short, memorable expression of a general truth
english.mnemonic: A furry animal promoted tourism (aphorism) using a short, memorable expression.
english.question: What is an aphorism?

english.definition: The complete final destruction of the world; destruction on a huge scale
english.mnemonic: A pockmark on her lips (apocalypse) was as bad to her as the complete destruction of the world.
english.question: What does the term apocalypse refer to?

english.definition: Probably not true although often told and believed by some people to have happened or of doubtful authenticity but widely believed to be true (or story or statement)
english.mnemonic: A guitarist pocketed a fortune for playing a few riffs to a full (apocryphal) house. It was widely believed she was self taught, but some doubted it and reckoned she had been tutored for years.
english.question: What does the term "apocryphal" mean?

english.definition: Not interested or involved in politics
english.mnemonic: Letter 'A' tied in a knot (not) will help you remember A is not.
english.question: What does it mean to be apolitical?

english.definition: 1. Each of the twelve chief disciples of Jesus Christ 2. Someone who strongly supports a particular belief or political movement
english.mnemonic: A possible (apostle) reason why their children had the same names as the twelve disciples of Jesus Christ was that they held a strong belief in Christianity.
english.question: What is an apostle?

english.definition: Clothing, especially outerwear garments
english.mnemonic: A parrot sulks (apparel) if it's made to wear clothing.
english.question: What is referred to as apparel?

english.definition: A ghostlike image of a person
english.mnemonic: A part of the partition (apparition) wall had a ghostlike image of a person drawn on it by a graffiti artist.
english.question: What is an apparition?

english.definition: 1. To make (someone) pleased or less angry by giving or saying something desired. 2. To make (a pain, a problem, etc.) less painful or troubling.
english.mnemonic: A pea was pleased (appease) after she was given some medicine. It made her less angry and her pain less troubling.
english.question: What does it mean to appease someone?

english.definition: Add something as a supplement, usually to a written document
english.mnemonic: The app ended (append). She knew because, right at the end, the words 'game over' were added.
english.question: What does it mean to append something?

english.definition: To be connected or belong to (especially in an official way)
english.mnemonic: Cats give a purr and abstain (appertain) from going for a walk on a lead. These are two traits that belong to a cat.
english.question: What does it mean to appertain?

english.definition: Feeling anxious about the future. Viewing the future with alarm.
english.mnemonic: The apprentice's comprehensive training (apprehensive) had prepared her well, but she still viewed the future with alarm.
english.question: What does it mean to feel apprehensive?

english.definition: Inform or tell (someone)
english.mnemonic: You've won a prize (apprise) and I'm here to tell you what it is.
english.question: What does it mean to apprise someone?

english.definition: Official authorisation
english.mnemonic: The approval came after the probationary (approbation) period. We now have official authorisation.
english.question: What does approbation mean?

english.definition: An accessory or other object associated with an activity or lifestyle
english.mnemonic: A purring cat is a tenant (appurtenance) of this house. Think of it as coming with, or an accessory of the house.
english.question: What is an appurtenance?

english.definition: Irrational fear of water and drowning
english.mnemonic: Aquatic animals don't usually drink foamy beer (aquaphobia), but this one has an irrational fear of water and drowning. So he prefers to sit on the beach sipping one.
english.question: What is aquaphobia?

english.definition: A structure for carrying water, typically in the form of a bridge across a valley.
english.mnemonic: I acquired this duct (aqueduct) but I can't stop the water coming out!
english.question: What is an aqueduct?

english.definition: (of land) used or suitable for growing crops
english.mnemonic: A load of rubble (arable) was dumped on the field. The farmer was furious as it was where she grew her crops.
english.question: What does "arable" mean when referring to land?

english.definition: Based on chance rather than planning or reason
english.mnemonic: Her arse was bitten by a hairy dog (arbitrary) but this was by chance because the dog was blind.
english.question: What does "arbitrary" mean?

english.definition: A person appointed to decide and settle disputes and differences
english.mnemonic: The mob accused us of harbouring a traitor (arbitrator). They called on a lawyer to settle the dispute.
english.question: Who is an arbitrator?

english.definition: Very old or old-fashioned
english.mnemonic: The archangel ached (archaic) because she was very old and carried an old-fashioned grandfather clock.
english.question: What does the term "archaic" mean?

english.definition: Typical example
english.mnemonic: Out of the ark came types (archetype) of animals that are still the typical examples we see today.
english.question: What is an archetype?

english.definition: The moulded frame round a doorway or window
english.mnemonic: The architect's grave (architrave) was like an elaborate building with moulded frames around the doorways just like she'd planned it before she died.
english.question: What is an architrave?

english.definition: A collection of historical records relating to a place, organisation, or family
english.mnemonic: "On the ark, I've stored a collection of historical records, instead of animals."
english.question: What is an archive?

english.definition: Very enthusiastic or passionate
english.mnemonic: "Ahh, a dent! (ardent) No problem sir. We can remove that. We're the best, we love dents." They were so enthusiastic and passionate.
english.question: What does it mean to be ardent?

english.definition: great enthusiasm or love
english.mnemonic: She works harder (ardour) than anyone, and shows great enthusiasm.
english.question: What does the term "ardour" mean?

english.definition: Difficult, tiring, and involves a lot of effort.
english.mnemonic: It will be hard work for you if you work for us (arduous). The job is difficult, tiring and involves a lot of effort.
english.question: What does the term "arduous" mean?

english.definition: (of land or climate) having little or no rain; too dry to support vegetation
english.mnemonic: This desert is a ridiculously (arid) dry place. It hasn't rained in years and is too dry to support vegetation.
english.question: What does "arid" mean in terms of climate or land?

english.definition: An agreement made by opposing sides in a war to stop fighting for a certain time; a truce.
english.mnemonic: They took off their armour and agreed that justice (armistice) could not be reached through war. The opposing sides made an agreement to stop fighting.
english.question: What is an armistice?

english.definition: A strong, pleasant smell
english.mnemonic: A romance (aroma) can only start if you have a pleasant smell.
english.question: What is an aroma?

english.definition: 1. An impressive display or range of a particular type of thing 2. An ordered series or arrangement
english.mnemonic: A ray (array) of sunlight shone on the impressive range of animals, who had neatly arranged themselves by size.
english.question: What is an array?

english.definition: Overdue payment. Money that is owed.
english.mnemonic: 'Er ears (arrears) have been done but she now owes money. She owes a Buccaneer.
english.question: What does it mean to be in arrears?

english.definition: An object of historical interest, such as an ancient pot or tool usually handmade by humans
english.mnemonic: The art was not made in a factory (artefact), it was made by hand many many years ago.
english.question: What is an artefact?

english.definition: Clever and skilful, especially in getting what you want
english.mnemonic: Her art was full (artful) of clever and skilful ideas, and she knew she could get whatever price she wanted.
english.question: What does it mean to be artful?

english.definition: A plant with a round mass of pointed leaves surrounding its flower that is eaten as a vegetable
english.mnemonic: After eating too quickly, the artist chokes (artichoke) on a vegetable with a mass of pointed leaves surrounding a flower.
english.question: What is an artichoke?

english.definition: Express one's ideas or feelings clearly
english.mnemonic: The articulated lorry (articulate) allowed him to express his ideas and feelings easily.
english.question: What does it mean to articulate?

english.definition: Clever trick, specially as used to deceive or trick others
english.mnemonic: The supposed art was a closed fist (artifice) with a magic wand. It was as if it was ready to perform a clever trick on the watching public.
english.question: What does the term "artifice" mean?

english.definition: A skilled worker (especially one who makes things by hand)
english.mnemonic: Art in sand (artisan) requires a high degree of skilled work.
english.question: What is an artisan?

english.definition: Lacking art, knowledge or skill; uncultured
english.mnemonic: The artist lusted (artless) for fame and fortune but lacked knowledge and skill.
english.question: What does it mean if someone is described as artless?

english.definition: The act of climbing or moving upwards.
english.mnemonic: A scent (ascent) wafted upwards to the top of the hill.
english.question: What is ascent?

english.definition: To find out for certain
english.mnemonic: Ass in pain (ascertain) was the only way to find out what happened.
english.question: What does it mean to ascertain something?

english.definition: Characterised by severe self-discipline and complete lack of indulgence or luxury, usually for religious reasons
english.mnemonic: A settee in the attic (ascetic) space was all she had. There were no luxuries.
english.question: What does it mean to be ascetic?

english.definition: Extremely stupid or foolish
english.mnemonic: The assassin, being only nine (asinine) tried a variety of methods that were extremely stupid.
english.question: What does the term "asinine" mean?

english.definition: A false and damaging remark
english.mnemonic: The ass of the person (aspersion) had a damaging remark.
english.question: What is an aspersion?

english.definition: 1. to attack violently 2. to criticise someone strongly
english.mnemonic: As they sailed (assail) towards the coast, the inhabitants knew this was going to be a violent attack. They criticised the king strongly for not having been ready.
english.question: What does it mean to assail?

english.definition: State a fact, belief or opinion confidently and forcefully
english.mnemonic: A certificate (assert) was given to any child who stated facts confidently and forcefully.
english.question: What does it mean to assert something?

english.definition: Valuable things; an item of property
english.mnemonic: An ass sat (asset) on all my valuable things.
english.question: What is an asset?

english.definition: Showing great care and effort
english.mnemonic: The ass was hidden from us (assiduous). They took great care and effort to hide the ass.
english.question: What does "assiduous" mean?

english.definition: 1. To give someone a job or responsibility 2. Designate or set (something) aside for a specific purpose
english.mnemonic: It was a sign (assign) that he would be given the job. They had been setting aside a task for someone just like him.
english.question: What does it mean to assign something?

english.definition: 1. To take in information or an idea and understand it fully. 2. Become absorbed and integrated into a society or culture.
english.mnemonic: An ass imitated a racehorse to gain late (assimilate) entry into the race; but when it finished last, it took in the idea that it was too slow and fully understood it shouldn't try again - it would never become integrated in horseracing society.
english.question: What does it mean to assimilate?

english.definition: Relieve, ease; make milder or less severe
english.mnemonic: As a wage a lottery win of £75,000 a week will make things much, much easier for this lady.
english.question: What does it mean to assuage something?

english.definition: Clever/ Cunning. Able to understand a situation quickly and take advantage.
english.mnemonic: As tutor (astute) she was able to tell that her student was really clever.
english.question: What does it mean to be astute?

english.definition: The protection granted by a state to someone who has left their country as a refugee
english.mnemonic: A sign said that lumberjack (asylum) refugees would be granted protection by the state.
english.question: What is asylum?

english.definition: A person who does not believe there is a god
english.mnemonic: A theology student missed (atheist) the last part of her course because she decided she did not believe in God after all.
english.question: What do you call a person who does not believe there is a god?

english.definition: Show that you are sorry and make amends
english.mnemonic: A toner (atone) cartridge was placed in the photocopier and immediately the photocopier printed out: "I'm sorry I ran out of toner, I'll make up for it now."
english.question: What does it mean to atone?

english.definition: Decrease in size or wasting away of a body part or tissue.
english.mnemonic: I once won a trophy (atrophy) for bodybuilding, but now my muscles are wasting away.
english.question: What happens to a body part when atrophy occurs?

english.definition: to declare or prove that something is true
english.mnemonic: She was put through a test (attest) to prove that she was the best.
english.question: What does it mean to attest?

english.definition: A way of thinking about something
english.mnemonic: At high altitudes (attitude), your way of thinking about something can change.
english.question: What is "attitude"?

english.definition: An attorney is a lawyer in America.
english.mnemonic: You got a turned knee (attorney) because you tripped, then you needed a lawyer.
english.question: What is the role of an attorney in America?

english.definition: Attrition means wearing down, or the gradual reduction of strength.
english.mnemonic: A trip soon (attrition) wore the kids down as they got to the top of the mountain.
english.question: What does the term attrition mean?

english.definition: Having a good or detailed knowledge
english.mnemonic: The ogre never fails (au fait) an exam. He had a detailed knowledge of many subjects.
english.question: What does it mean to be au fait with a subject?

english.definition: Inspection of a company's accounts by an independent body
english.mnemonic: The company owner wanted to hoard it (audit) but the inspection of accounts uncovered his stash of cash.
english.question: What is an audit?

english.definition: Make something better by adding to it; increase
english.mnemonic: The heat in August is meant (augment) to increase.
english.question: What does it mean to augment something?

english.definition: Relating to the ear or sense of hearing
english.mnemonic: Remember mouth is oral and ear is aural.
english.question: What does "aural" refer to?

english.definition: Favourable- showing signs that something is likely to be successful
english.mnemonic: All suspicious (auspicious) characters, but they were asked to turn out their pockets... and then there was a favourable outcome for the police.
english.question: What does the term "auspicious" mean?

english.definition: Severe or strict in manner / very simple and without comfort
english.mnemonic: The oar steered (austere) the simple boat that had few comforts.
english.question: What does the term "austere" mean?

english.definition: A system of government where one person holds absolute power
english.mnemonic: He was automobile crazy (autocracy). He had the power to take anyone's car and whatever else he liked.
english.question: What is autocracy?

english.definition: A ruler with absolute power.
english.mnemonic: His autocue was attacked by a rat (autocrat) so the dictator found it hard to make his speech.
english.question: What is an autocrat?

english.definition: Art and artists ahead of their time; very original or modern methods and styles.
english.mnemonic: The advanced guard (avant-garde) were guarding a head (ahead of their time).
english.question: What does avant-garde refer to in art?

english.definition: Extreme greed for wealth or material gain
english.mnemonic: Have a rice (avarice) pile so big that it contrasts and shows up the greed next to someone with so little rice.
english.question: What does the term "avarice" mean?

english.definition: State very firmly that something is true
english.mnemonic: It was a virgin (aver) birth, she stated very firmly, but few were convinced.
english.question: What does it mean to aver something?

english.definition: A strong dislike or disinclination towards something.
english.mnemonic: There was a new version (aversion) of the computer game that the players had a strong dislike of.
english.question: What is the term for a strong dislike or disinclination towards something?

english.definition: The feeling of respect and amazement mixed with fear and wonder
english.mnemonic: While orbiting (awe) the earth, the astronaut felt a feeling of respect and amazement mixed with fear and wonder.
english.question: What is awe?

english.definition: In the U.K, a member of parliament who does not hold office and sits on the back benches of the House of Commons
english.mnemonic: At the back on a bench (backbencher) the least important members of parliament sit.
english.question: What is a backbencher in the U.K.?

english.definition: A mere trifle; something of little value or importance.
english.mnemonic: The bag, you could tell (bagatelle) had a mere trifle in it.
english.question: What does "bagatelle" mean?

english.definition: Threatening harmful or expressing harmful intentions
english.mnemonic: The bale of hay was lifted fully (baleful) above his head and the farmer threatened to drop it on his head.
english.question: What does "baleful" mean?

english.definition: A sentimental or romantic song/poem
english.mnemonic: The ballerina cuddled (ballad) her boyfriend while listening to a romantic pop song.
english.question: What is a ballad?

english.definition: To trick or deceive someone
english.mnemonic: My bamboo's all (bamboozle) gone! That panda tricked me!
english.question: What does it mean to bamboozle someone?

english.definition: Harmful or destructive
english.mnemonic: The brain was full (baneful) of harmful materials.
english.question: What does the term "baneful" mean?

english.definition: Not showing any shame about your bad behaviour
english.mnemonic: They were bare as they faced (barefaced) the audience and showed no shame.
english.question: What does it mean to be barefaced?

english.definition: To be unwilling to do something. Hesitate or refuse to go on.
english.mnemonic: With the bulk (baulk) of the load to carry, the donkey refused and was unwilling to go on.
english.question: What does it mean to baulk?

english.definition: To proclaim someone to be one of the blessed, worthy of public religious veneration. First step towards making someone a saint.
english.mnemonic: "Here's a bee hat if I may (beatify)." "Oh my, you are a saint"
english.question: What does it mean to beatify someone?

english.definition: Beautiful
english.mnemonic: The landscape's beauty was obvious (beauteous).
english.question: What does the term "beauteous" mean?

english.definition: To decorate or cover
english.mnemonic: The bull decorated (bedeck) his room, covering the walls with posters.
english.question: What does it mean to bedeck something?

english.definition: Wet, dirty, and untidy
english.mnemonic: If you have just been dragged and pulled (bedraggled) through rain and dirt, then you will certainly be wet, dirty and untidy.
english.question: What does it mean if someone looks bedraggled?

english.definition: (especially of something bad) happen to (someone)
english.mnemonic: I saw a bin fall (befall) on him, which is a terrible thing to happen to someone.
english.question: What does "befall" mean when referring to an event, especially if it's negative?

english.definition: Give reluctantly; envy someone's possession or enjoyment of something
english.mnemonic: The bee had a real grudge (begrudge) and she was reluctant to give her honey to the hive. She envied how much the hive already had.
english.question: What does it mean to begrudge something?

english.definition: Charm or enchant (someone), often in a deceptive way
english.mnemonic: It began with a smile (beguile). He charmed her but was soon asking for a large loan.
english.question: What does it mean to beguile?

english.definition: A person's orders
english.mnemonic: At the bees nest (behest) the bees would obey a person's orders.
english.question: What does "behest" mean?

english.definition: Fix a running rope around an object to secure it
english.mnemonic: He used a big lace (belay) from the giants shoe like a running rope. He fixed it around a rock to secure it, then began climbing down.
english.question: What does it mean to belay in climbing?

english.definition: To cause lots of problems or difficulties for someone or something
english.mnemonic: The B Leaguer (beleaguer) felt the coach was causing a lot of problems and making it more difficult for her.
english.question: What does it mean to beleaguer someone or something?

english.definition: To give a false impression. To represent something falsely
english.mnemonic: The bee lied (belie) she said it wouldn't hurt. She gave a false impression.
english.question: What does it mean to belie something?

english.definition: Make a person or action appear unimportant
english.mnemonic: "Be little!" (belittle) the genie said. Suddenly the intimidating character became someone you could easily dismiss as unimportant.
english.question: What does it mean to belittle someone?

english.definition: A drug obtained from leaves and roots of the deadly nightshade
english.mnemonic: He rung the bell for a doner (Belladonna) kebab but received a drug made from the leaves and roots of a deadly Nightshade.
english.question: What is Belladonna?

english.definition: Wishing to fight or argue
english.mnemonic: With his belly, be vigilant (belligerent) because he uses it to fight.
english.question: What does it mean to be belligerent?

english.definition: Puzzled, slightly confused or bewildered
english.mnemonic: Be amused (bemused) by this. They are so confused.
english.question: What does it mean to be bemused?

english.definition: A blessing, especially at the end of a religious service
english.mnemonic: She tried to bend and tear a dictionary (benediction). When she'd had the blessing she could do it.
english.question: What is a benediction?

english.definition: Kindly or charitable acts
english.mnemonic: Everyone thought Big Ben looked violent (benevolent) when he bent over, but he was doing a kindly act, laying a cloth over a puddle.
english.question: What does "benevolent" mean?

english.definition: Gentle and kind. No danger to life or well being.
english.mnemonic: Be mine (benign) and I'll be kind and gentle.
english.question: What does it mean if something is described as benign?

english.definition: To speak in an angry manner to someone
english.mnemonic: 'B-rated! B-rated!', (berate) he shouted in an angry manner. 'You need to be A-rated. You must do better!'
english.question: What does it mean to berate someone?

english.definition: 1. Lacking something 2. Sad and lonely
english.mnemonic: He always wanted to be a ref but it left (bereft) him lacking friends and sad and lonely.
english.question: What does "bereft" mean?

english.definition: Ask someone to do something in an intense and desperate way
english.mnemonic: The bee screeched (beseech) at the person not to damage her home but they couldn't hear her, and desperate pleading was to no avail.
english.question: What does it mean to beseech someone?

english.definition: 1. Having a lot of trouble with something 2. Be covered or studded with something
english.mnemonic: The bees' latest setup (beset) was not good. The family were having a lot of trouble. Then the bees set upon the family and covered them in stings.
english.question: What does the term "beset" mean?

english.definition: surround (a place) with armed forces in order to capture it or force its surrender
english.mnemonic: Before a siege (besiege), you must surround the castle with armed forces in order to capture it or force its surrender.
english.question: What does it mean to besiege a place?

english.definition: smear or cover with a greasy or sticky substance
english.mnemonic: The bee smeared (besmear) and covered the cake in sticky honey.
english.question: What does it mean to besmear?

english.definition: Splash drops all over
english.mnemonic: She had a bin that she spat her (bespatter) gum into, but she splashed drops of spit all over it.
english.question: What does it mean to bespatter?

english.definition: Give or present an honour, title, right or gift
english.mnemonic: The big man became a stowaway (bestow) on a boat - in his earlier life, he'd been presented with honours, titles, rights and gifts, but now he was a pauper.
english.question: What does it mean to bestow something?

english.definition: Drinks of any type, other than water.
english.mnemonic: In Beverley Hills, people spend ages (beverages) having drinks in cocktail bars.
english.question: What are beverages?

english.definition: A lens that has two parts, one for near vision and one for distance.
english.mnemonic: Bike-riding folk singers all (bifocal) wear glasses with two part lenses. They play their guitars looking through one part while scanning the distance through the other.
english.question: What is a bifocal?

english.definition: To divide into two branches or parts
english.mnemonic: My bike was covered in fur, so they decided to confiscate (bifurcate) it and cut it up, dividing it into two.
english.question: What does it mean to bifurcate?

english.definition: A person who is intolerant of any ideas other than his or her own (especially on religion, politics, or race)
english.mnemonic: The big hut (bigot) came out with a big axe because she was intolerant of other people's views.
english.question: What is a bigot?

english.definition: Very angry feelings, words or behaviour. Bile is also a greenish brown liquid that aids in digestion in vertebrae and one of the four humors in medieval medicine.
english.mnemonic: Bye all (bile) but why are you leaving us? We are so angry.
english.question: What does bile refer to in terms of both human emotions and ancient medicine?

english.definition: Study of chemical substances and processes within living organisms
english.mnemonic: Biochemistry means life-chemistry or, more appropriately, the study of life or living organisms and chemistry.
english.question: What is biochemistry?

english.definition: An animal that uses two legs for walking
english.mnemonic: The bicycle had two pedals (biped); it had no room for anything with more than two legs.
english.question: What is a biped?

english.definition: To vote against allowing someone to be a member of an organisation.
english.mnemonic: I blacked out his name on the ball's (blackball) guest list after we voted against allowing him to be a member of our club.
keywords: to be a member of our club
english.question: What does it mean to blackball someone in an organization?

english.definition: Flattery or pleasing statement used to persuade
english.mnemonic: The bland dish meant (blandishment) that they were not bothered what impression they made...
english.question: What is blandishment?

english.definition: Insult God or a sacred thing
english.mnemonic: They blasted this female (blaspheme) into space because she insulted their god.
english.question: What does it mean to blaspheme?

english.definition: a mark or flaw that spoils the appearance of something
english.mnemonic: Blending a mishmash (blemish) of food without the top on will leave marks everywhere and spoils the appearance of any kitchen.
english.question: What is a blemish?

english.definition: 1. make a sudden flinching movement out of fear or pain 2. become pale
english.mnemonic: The blood in the trench (blench) made the soldier flinch and go pale.
english.question: What does it mean to blench?

english.definition: 1. A disease which makes plants wither 2. Something that causes great difficulties
english.mnemonic: Bring the light (blight) so we can examine this leaf more carefully and see the disease which makes the plant wither. If this disease gets out, it will cause great difficulties.
english.question: What is blight?

english.definition: Showing a casual, cheerful indifference, seen by others as irresponsible or even callous.
english.mnemonic: Being lithe (blithe) meant she could do all the ballet moves better than the rest, but she showed a lack of interest by studying her phone during the lessons, and just smiled when one girl broke her leg.
english.question: What does "blithe" mean?

english.definition: Deliberately unhelpful attitude
english.mnemonic: It was bloody down the mine where several were found dead (bloody-minded) after the accident; from then on, the miners were deliberately unhelpful to the management.
english.question: What does it mean to be bloody-minded?

english.definition: A thick stick with a heavy end, used as a weapon
english.mnemonic: There was going to be a lot of blood in the jungle (bludgeon) tonight as the natives stood around with heavy clubs.
english.question: What is a bludgeon?

english.definition: Manual worker
english.mnemonic: Blue-collared shirts (blue-collared worker) are the only thing to wear down here: manual workers don't wear white, they wear blue!
english.question: What is a blue-collar worker?

english.definition: A short, large-barrelled gun that shoots lots of small metal balls.
english.mnemonic: It was a blunder to arm the school bus (blunderbuss) with short, large-barrelled guns.
english.question: What is a blunderbuss?

english.definition: 1. Loud aggressive talk; 2. Storm or wind
english.mnemonic: Blast her (bluster) with loud and aggressive talk.
english.question: What does the term "bluster" mean?

english.definition: false or not true
english.mnemonic: The giant bogie (bogus) was a joke — it was a false bogie.
english.question: What does the term bogus mean?

english.definition: Socially unconventional person, especially involved in the arts
english.mnemonic: The bow on the man (bohemian) was pink and in his hair. It was very different, socially unconventional, and made him stand out from the crowd.

english.definition: Pompous or high-sounding words.

english.question: What does it mean to be brazen?

english.mnemonic: On the beach, the soldier reached (breach) the German walls and blew a gap in them. He broke his mum's agreement that he wouldn't put himself in danger.

english.mnemonic: With his container filled to the brim, the stone (Brimstone) man carried the sulphur from the volcano.

english.mnemonic: The brooch (broach) she was wearing was strange. I had to raise the subject of why she was wearing it for discussion.

english.mnemonic: The bronze statue held a tin can with a little copper (police officer) inside.
english.question: What is the composition of bronze?

english.definition: tolerate or allow; to put up with

english.question: What does it mean to browbeat someone?

english.question: What does "brusque" mean?

english.definition: a cause of obsessive fear, anxiety, or irritation

english.definition: A defensive wall of earth or other material

english.question: What is bureaucracy?

english.definition: 1. A small part, performed by a distinguished actor. 2. Item of jewellery, often a brooch, with a portrait in profile carved in relief on a background of a different colour.

english.definition: Honest, truthful and straightforward

english.definition: Frankness. Open and honest

english.definition: Clever, especially in business and finance

english.definition: Roman Catholic Church officially declaring a dead person to be a saint

english.definition: Bad tempered, argumentative

english.question: What does "cantankerous" mean?

english.definition: An economical, political and social system in which property, business and industry are privately owned, directed towards making the greatest possible profits.
english.mnemonic: Fill the capital with prisms (capitalism) – that was the architect's plan, and she thought she could make lots of profit out of the idea.

english.definition: A large scale and violent event in the natural world
english.mnemonic: The cat will clear some (cataclysm) of the rocks away after the large scale natural disaster.

english.definition: Give up (power or territory); surrender; transfer something willingly to someone else

english.definition: scold or rebuke

english.definition: 1. Find a way round. 2. Overcome a problem in a clever way.

english.definition: A fortress (typically one on high ground above a city)

english.definition: To quote or refer to (a text or author) as evidence to justify a statement or argument.

english.definition: Clear and logical

english.mnemonic: "Go inside" he said (coincide) because he knew that the child losing her temper happened at the same time as when she was hungry.

english.definition: Informal word or expression more suitable in speech than in writing (not necessarily in regional dialect)
english.mnemonic: The cloak quizzed them (colloquialism) using very informal language

english.mnemonic: Collectors of illusions (collusion) and magic tricks made a secret agreement in order to deceive audiences.

english.definition: An item of food
english.mnemonic: Come, it's edible (comestible). It's a great item of food, full of nutrition.
english.question: What is a comestible?

english.definition: A punishment or fate that someone deserves
english.mnemonic: You come up and balance (comeuppance) said the circus performer to the heckler. When the heckler tried it, she immediately fell off. It was a punishment that she deserved.
english.question: What is the meaning of comeuppance?

english.definition: Buying and selling on a large scale
english.mnemonic: Computerised nurses (commerce) will be useful all over the world. They will be bought and sold on a large scale.
english.question: What is commerce?

english.definition: For profit; Organizations or businesses that make, or intend to make, a profit. Also refers to an advertisement made for TV.
english.mnemonic: Putting commercials (commercial) on TV was the only way they could make a profit.
english.question: What does "commercial" mean in business and advertising contexts?

english.definition: Having a lot of space
english.mnemonic: The commode was odious (commodious) so it was placed in a room with a lot of space.
english.question: What does commodious mean?

english.definition: Shared by a group of people rather than one single person
english.mnemonic: The commune had all (communal) sorts of people living in it, and they all shared the facilities.
english.question: What does the term "communal" mean?

english.definition: A system of social organisation or government in which all property is owned by the state and each person contributes and receives according to their ability and needs.
english.mnemonic: The community voted for nudism (communism) - because the government owns everything, they might as well take the clothes, too.
english.question: What is communism?

english.definition: 1. Travel some distance between one's home and place of work on a regular basis. 2. Reduce a judicial sentence (especially a sentence of death) to another less severe one.
english.mnemonic: She started composed, but turned into a crazed mutant (commute). Travelling such a distance between home and work finally made her crack. She was thrown in jail for a long time, but the sentence was reduced when she finally became human again.
english.question: What does it mean to commute?

english.definition: The range or scope of something
english.mnemonic: Compass? You want a compass? Which one? We have a complete range.
english.question: What is the compass of something referring to?

english.definition: Feeling or showing sympathy and concern for others
english.mnemonic: She was competitive and passionate (compassionate) about winning, but she also showed sympathy and concern for the other competitors.
english.question: What does it mean to be compassionate?

english.definition: A fellow citizen of a nation or country
english.mnemonic: The couple was compatible because they were both patriots (compatriot) from the same country.
english.question: Who is referred to as a compatriot?

english.definition: force or oblige (someone) to do something
english.mnemonic: Come and pelt (compel) them until they carry out the task. That will force them to finish.
english.question: What does it mean to compel someone?

english.definition: Able to do something well
english.mnemonic: At the competition of the ants it was obvious they were all able to do something very well.
english.question: What does it mean to be competent?

english.definition: Smug and self-satisfied
english.mnemonic: The complaint was sent (complacent) but it was ignored in a smug and self-satisfied way.
english.question: What does it mean to be complacent?

english.definition: Worsen; to make a problem or situation worse than it was to start with
english.mnemonic: She composed a song about a hound (compound) which the critics slated, but when she tried to rewrite it, she just made it worse than it was before.
english.question: What does it mean to compound a problem?

english.definition: A guilty feeling about something you have done or might do.
english.mnemonic: Come and puncture my cushion (compunction) - But you'll have a guilty feeling after you've done it.
english.question: What does the term compunction mean?

english.definition: A friend, especially a fellow member of a fighting unit. It means a colleague or fellow member of an organisation.
english.mnemonic: "Comb your hair before the raid (comrade), my fellow fighting friends," said the commander.
english.question: What does "comrade" mean?

english.definition: Unprovable estimation of one's worth or ability
english.mnemonic: The con sold a seat (conceit). The new owner was proud and overly confident of its worth.
english.question: What does the term "conceit" mean?

english.definition: A principle or idea
english.mnemonic: The convict couldn't accept (concept) that his principles and ideas were immoral.
english.question: What does the term "concept" refer to?

english.definition: End a disagreement with someone
english.mnemonic: The con went silly and ate (conciliate) his mate's biscuits, so the prison guard was brought in to end the disagreement.
english.question: How do you conciliate an argument with someone?

english.definition: Short and clear; expressing what needs to be said without unnecessary words
english.mnemonic: The convict sliced (concise) his finger off and expressed himself in a short and clear way.
english.question: What does it mean to be concise?

english.definition: A private meeting
english.mnemonic: In the cons' cave (conclave), they held a private meeting.
english.question: What is a conclave?

english.definition: Agreement or harmony between people or groups.
english.mnemonic: The convicts were cordial (concord) to each other after reaching an agreement.
english.question: What is concord?

english.definition: A woman who lives with and has sex with a married man
english.mnemonic: Conquer and combine (concubine): all the ladies are taken into the soldiers' homes to live with the married men and their wives.
english.question: What is a concubine?

english.definition: Agree; have the same opinion
english.mnemonic: Conker (concur) fighting was something they both loved, they agreed on that.
english.question: What does it mean to concur?

english.definition: To do something but behave as if you are descending from a superior position to do it
english.mnemonic: The queen consorted with them by descending (condescending) the staircase, she was higher than them and in a much superior position.
english.question: What does it mean to condescend?

english.definition: A substance such as salt, pepper, mustard or other spices added to food, typically after cooking.
english.mnemonic: She conned him, what was meant (condiment) to be a great adventure turned out to be a daily grind.
english.question: What is a condiment?

english.definition: An apartment building in which each apartment is individually owned and common areas are jointly owned so residents pay shared upkeep.
english.mnemonic: I condone a minimum (condominium) extra charge for looking after my property and amenities.
english.question: What is a condominium?

english.definition: 1. Exchange opinions 2. Give an honour
english.mnemonic: The convicts wore fur (confer) coats and as they walked by the judges exchanged opinions. Eventually they gave the honour of best fur coat to one of them.
english.question: What does the term "confer" mean?

english.definition: someone who behaves or thinks like most people rather than doing things that are original
english.mnemonic: The consequence of their behaviour was that mum formed a list (conformist) of how she wanted them to behave like all the other kids.
english.question: What is a conformist?

english.definition: A serious dispute between two groups of people often as a result of them having opposing ideas
english.mnemonic: If you continue to shout in front of the opposing crowd, it will cause agitation (confrontation). You have opposing views, and there will be a hostile dispute.
english.question: What is a confrontation?

english.definition: To prove a person or an argument to be wrong
english.mnemonic: Knowing he was confused, she disputed (confute) his argument and proved him wrong.
english.question: What does it mean to confute someone?

english.definition: To change from fluid to semi solid; set
english.mnemonic: The conger eel (congeal) couldn't swim in the jelly as it set.
english.question: What does it mean for a substance to congeal?

english.definition: Friendly and pleasant; agreeable or compatible.
english.mnemonic: The con knows the genie will (congenial) bring friends and pleasant things with his three wishes.
english.question: What does "congenial" mean?

english.definition: A thing made up of a number of different parts; big corporation formed by a merger of several companies.
english.mnemonic: Kong longed for a mate (conglomerate) to help carry all the different parts of companies he owned since becoming famous.
english.question: What is a conglomerate?

english.definition: Two groups of lawmakers that meet in Washington DC. These are the Senate and the House of Representatives.
english.mnemonic: King Kong's dress (congress) hides two groups of lawmakers.
english.question: What is Congress?

english.definition: In agreement
english.mnemonic: The con grew ants (congruent) that always seemed to agree to go in straight lines.
english.question: What does "congruent" mean in terms of agreement?

english.definition: The change that takes place in a verb to express tense, mood, person, and so on.
english.mnemonic: She conjured up a delegation (conjugation) to attend the conference on how to teach the different forms of verbs to students.
english.question: What is conjugation in grammar?

english.definition: A raised platform on a ship or submarine to help navigation and attack direction.
english.mnemonic: She was conning me saying she'd sell me a tower (conning tower) – it was just a raised platform from a ship that had been used for navigation and was now rusting in the dockyard.
english.question: What is a conning tower on a ship or submarine?

english.definition: Secretly allow (something, immoral, illegal or harmful).
english.mnemonic: To con their husbands, the wives (connive) conspired secretly to always have alibis when they met their lovers.
english.question: What does it mean to connive?

english.definition: Secretly allow (something, immoral, illegal or harmful).
english.mnemonic: The convict got the knives (connive) because she secretly smuggled them in.
english.question: What does it mean to connive?

english.definition: An expert judge in matters of taste such as art, food, or drink
english.mnemonic: We couldn't con her - she was certain (connoisseur) about the quality of all the food. She was an expert judge.
english.question: What is a connoisseur?

english.definition: An idea or feeling which a word invokes (or implies) for a person in addition to its primary meaning; to have a secondary meaning to a literal meaning; the emotional meaning.
english.mnemonic: The convict had written a note at the police station (connotation) and the words implied there was a second (secondary meaning) person involved.
english.question: What is meant by the connotation of a word?

english.definition: General agreement; a generally accepted opinion or decision
english.mnemonic: The con sent us (consensus) away which we all agreed to do but in reality, they were robbing the bank.
english.question: What does consensus mean?

english.definition: 1. Tending not to like change. 2. Politically, favoring low taxation and low government involvement in industry. 3. A conservative estimate is an estimate that is purposely low for the sake of caution.
english.mnemonic: In the conservatory there lives (conservative) a tax officer who is small (to remind you of low/small taxes) and he is standing watering his plants with his pockets hanging out, so he has no change (to remind you that conservative don't like change). Someone is outside looking at estimates for a conservatory extension. The lowest estimate has won (to remind you that a conservative estimate is a low one).
english.question: What does the term "conservative" mean in a political and general context?

english.definition: To send something to someone
english.mnemonic: The convict signed (consign) for the cake. Her mother had decided to send it for her birthday.
english.question: What does it mean to consign something?

english.definition: 1. Make something physically stronger or more solid. 2. Combine a number of things into a single, more effective unit.
english.mnemonic: They had to consult on a date (consolidate) for combining the three businesses into one to become stronger in the long run.
english.question: What does it mean to consolidate?

english.definition: A group's secret plot with evil purposes
english.mnemonic: He saw containers spilling rubbish into the sea (conspiracy) and took photographs. He was investigating a group's secret plot with evil purposes.
english.question: What is a conspiracy?

english.definition: Quality of being unchanging/faithful
english.mnemonic: She was constantly at sea (constancy). Even if you pleaded with her to come on to land, she was unchanging and faithful to the sea.
english.question: What is the quality of being unchanging or faithful referred to as?

english.definition: A recognised group of stars that form a pattern, often linked with an animal or mythological figure.
english.mnemonic: A con stall (constellation) trying to sell you stars.
english.question: What is a constellation?

english.definition: 1. Be a part of a whole; Combine to form a complete thing 2. Be, or be equivalent to, something
english.mnemonic: The constant tooting (constitute) and noise combined to form the equivalent of a jet taking off.
english.question: What does it mean to constitute something?

english.definition: The using of goods and services in an economy or the amount of goods and services used
english.mnemonic: The convict's assumption (consumption) before she was arrested was that she could use all goods and services for her benefit any time she chose.
english.question: What is consumption in an economic context?

english.definition: Occurring now, existing in the present
english.mnemonic: The con temporarily (contemporary) had to go into solitude right NOW!
english.question: What does the term "contemporary" mean?

english.definition: 1. A feeling that a person or thing is beneath consideration, worthless. 2. Disobedience or open disrespect for the rules of a court.
english.mnemonic: The con tempted (contempt) her with a Rolex but she was sure it was worthless. The con also tempted (contempt) the judge in court. He had a total disrespect for the rules.
english.question: What is contempt?

english.definition: Likely to cause an argument
english.mnemonic: The content was precious (contentious) and caused an argument between the rival pirates.
english.question: What does the term "contentious" mean?

english.definition: A state of happiness and satisfaction
english.mnemonic: The contents of the ointment (contentment) keep you in a state of happiness and satisfaction.
english.question: What is contentment?

english.definition: Sharing a common border; touching
english.mnemonic: The fact about these two continents is unambiguous (contiguous); they definitely share a common border.
english.question: What does it mean if something is contiguous?

english.definition: 1. Dependent on; 2. Existing only if certain circumstances are the case
english.mnemonic: You can continue, gents, (contingent) playing cards but it is dependent on you looking after the baby. The group all said yes in unison.
english.question: What does it mean when something is contingent?

english.definition: To assert the contrary or opposite
english.mnemonic: The contract caused trouble because the manager dictated (contradict) it but the secretary had written the opposite meaning of his words.
english.question: What does it mean to contradict?

english.definition: To break a law or rule
english.mnemonic: She tried to control a ravine (contravene) of water but it broke her.
english.question: What does it mean to contravene a law?

english.definition: Being sorry and feeling guilty for something bad that you have done
english.mnemonic: The content of her speech was right (contrite) – she expressed sorrow and admitted guilt for her past actions.
english.question: What does it mean to be contrite?

english.definition: Arrange or create something with clever planning
english.mnemonic: To control this drive (contrive) needs clever planning.
english.question: What does it mean to contrive something?

english.definition: Prolonged public disagreement or heated discussion
english.mnemonic: Can you contro(l) an ad(versary)? (controversy) This is a prolonged public disagreement.
english.question: What is controversy?

english.definition: Medical term for a bruise
english.mnemonic: There was continuous confusion (contusion) when she went to the hospital. The doctors were worried but as a gymnast, it was normal for her body to be covered in bruises.
english.question: What is a contusion?

english.definition: A difficult or confusing problem
english.mnemonic: The convict undid the drum (conundrum) and ran off with it, which left a difficult problem for the drummer who was supposed to perform live in an hour.
english.question: What is a conundrum?

english.definition: To be familiar with and knowledgeable about something
english.mnemonic: The conversation with the ant (conversant) showed that she was knowledgeable about the topic.
english.question: What does it mean to be conversant?

english.definition: A car with a soft roof that can be folded down or removed
english.mnemonic: To convert the car is not sensible (convertible) when it rains because when the roof is folded back, the rain gets in.
english.question: What is a convertible?

english.definition: Friendly, lively and enjoyable in relation to an atmosphere or event
english.mnemonic: The animal psychologist convinced the farmer that he could make the bulls more jovial (convivial). She could create an atmosphere that was friendly, lively and enjoyable.
english.question: What does "convivial" mean when describing an atmosphere or event?

english.definition: Shake violently with sudden movements.
english.mnemonic: The con's pulse (convulse) had gone so they tried shaking her.
english.question: What does it mean to convulse?

english.definition: Large amounts
english.mnemonic: Can the teacher cope with us (copious) as there is such a large number of us?
english.question: What does "copious" mean?

english.definition: An area of closely planted trees in which the trees are cut back regularly to provide wood
english.mnemonic: The cop is (coppice) collecting wood from an area of closely planted trees that are cut back regularly.
english.question: What is a coppice?

english.definition: Feeding on dung
english.mnemonic: Curse the prof, it was a disgusting (coprophagous) experiment. She made us watch beetles feeding on dung.
english.question: What does it mean if an animal is coprophagous?

english.definition: 1. Friendly and welcoming 2. A sweet, fruit flavoured drink
english.mnemonic: Tie a cord on the eel (cordial) so it can't drink my sweet, fruit flavoured drink or disturb my friendly and welcoming chat.
english.question: What are the meanings of cordial?

english.definition: 1. A curved hollow goat's horn (overflowing with fruit and vegetables); a symbol of plenty. 2. An abundance of something.
english.mnemonic: There was so much corn you couldn't cope with it, you even had some in your ear (cornucopia). There was such an abundance that people even filled goat's horns up with it.
english.question: What is a cornucopia?

english.definition: Confirm or give support to an idea or statement
english.mnemonic: Evidence of the custard the robber ate (corroborate) confirms that he was at the crime scene.
english.question: What does it mean to corroborate?

english.definition: Dishonest or unreliable
english.mnemonic: They saw the core erupt (corrupt) and the nuclear power station officials were turning into lizards with forked tongues (lying, dishonest) and denied anything had happened.
english.question: What does it mean when someone is described as corrupt?

english.definition: From all parts of the world. A cosmopolitan place contains people and things from many different parts of the world.
english.mnemonic: The cosmonaut (cosmopolitan) had to deliver all over the world.
english.image: /images/user/base/uncategorised/4. Cosmopolitan means from all parts of the world.jpg
english.question: What does the term "cosmopolitan" mean?

english.definition: A small and exclusive group of friends with shared interests
english.mnemonic: Making coats out of batteries (coterie) is the shared interest of this small and exclusive group of friends.
english.question: What is a coterie?

english.definition: A person's face or facial expression
english.mnemonic: She counted the tenants (countenance) being evicted and noticed their facial expressions.
english.question: What does the term "countenance" refer to in relation to a person?

english.definition: something that forms a pleasing or notable contrast to something else
english.mnemonic: On the kitchen counter, I point (counterpoint) to two ingredients that form a contrast to one another.
english.question: What is counterpoint in terms of contrast?

english.definition: 1. A sudden, violent and illegal seizure of power from a government. 2. Achievement of something difficult.
english.mnemonic: "Cooey! (coup) Come out so I can take over your government." Although he'd achieved something difficult, the president's time was up.
english.question: What is a coup?

english.definition: A daily report of the activities and public engagements of the royal family members
english.mnemonic: She was caught circulating (court circular) the daily activities of the king and queen.
english.question: What is the Court Circular?

english.definition: Military court
english.mnemonic: Any soldier caught in the marsh shall (court-martial) face a military court, the general warned.
english.question: What is a court-martial?

english.definition: Polite, respectful or considerate
english.mnemonic: Curtsying to us (courteous) is polite and considerate.
english.question: What does it mean to be courteous?

english.definition: A prostitute with a wealthy or upper-class client
english.mnemonic: Caught with only her sandals (courtesan) on, her mother suddenly realised she was a prostitute for the wealthy.
english.question: What is a courtesan?

english.definition: Very polite and refined, as befitting a royal court.
english.mnemonic: In court you have to be the opposite of silly (courtly), you should be very polite and refined.
english.question: What does it mean if someone's behavior is described as courtly?

english.definition: Good manners, cultivated and refined
english.mnemonic: Cool youths (couth) can have pleasant manners, too.
english.question: What does the term "couth" mean?

english.definition: 1. Pretends to be shy. 2. Unwilling to talk about something.
english.mnemonic: The koi (coy) fish always pretends to be shy but it is button-lipped, unwilling to talk about why.
english.question: What does it mean when someone is described as coy?

english.definition: Stupid and not considering of how others feel
english.mnemonic: What a crazy ass (crass), she's just really stupid.
english.question: What does crass mean?

english.definition: A set of beliefs that influence how a person behaves; can also mean a system of religious beliefs.
english.mnemonic: Credentials (creed) were shown by all to show they had a belief.
english.question: What is a creed?

english.definition: Sad and disappointed
english.mnemonic: His family crest has fallen (crestfallen) down, which made him sad and disappointed.
english.question: What does it mean to feel crestfallen?

english.definition: Standards by which someone or something is judged.
english.mnemonic: She cried tears (criteria) because she couldn't reach her hat on the giant hat stand (standards).
english.question: What are criteria?

english.definition: A detailed analysis of something. A written examination and judgement of a person's work.
