languages.question: What is the English translation of the Spanish term "bosque"?

languages.mnemonic: Wood or madeira (madera) cake? The woodlouse couldn't decided.
languages.question: What does "la madera" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: There's a word for what he did when he helped his pal with his algebra (palabra) exam – cheating!
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for "word"?

languages.mnemonic: If you work too hard you'll feel like you're trapped behind prison bars and in a harness (trabajar).
languages.question: What is the Spanish verb for "to work"?

languages.mnemonic: The world was far from convinced by an early theory that the moon was made of dough (mundo).
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el mundo"?

languages.mnemonic: He decided to write a poem about his girlfriend but she didn't like the way he described her (escribir).
languages.question: What is the meaning of the verb "escribir" in English?

languages.mnemonic: The surgeon got it wrong; he amputated the incorrect toe (incorrecto).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "wrong"?

languages.mnemonic: Their backyard is tiny - it's just a little patio (patio).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "yard"?

languages.mnemonic: Patio is masculine, so it's el patio. Imagine an elephant living in someone's little back yard.
languages.question: What does "el patio" refer to in English?

languages.mnemonic: This year, the annual yoga (año) contest returns to London.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el año"?

languages.mnemonic: Año is masculine, so it's el año. Imagine an "elephant never forgets" calendar for the year.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el año"?

languages.mnemonic: Yellow had been painted on the back of the armadillo (amarillo). Was it a coward?
languages.question: What does "el amarillo/la amarilla" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: She said her answer was yes – but only if they could get married at sea (sí).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "yes"?

languages.mnemonic: Yesterday I ran out of petrol. Ah! – if only I'd carried a jerrycan (ayer) of fuel in the back!
languages.question: What does "ayer" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: We cannot relax yet, we've still got a toast, dance and beer (todavía) to drink!
languages.question: What is the English translation of the Spanish word "todavía"?

languages.mnemonic: I asked you to come to the cinema with me, but you brought your brother too (tú), who instead (usted) of letting us sit together, sat between us.
languages.question: What are the Spanish pronouns used for "you" in both informal and formal contexts?

languages.mnemonic: The young gardener could use the hoe without bending (joven) over.
languages.question: What is the meaning of "joven"?

languages.mnemonic: Your head is too (tu) big for that hat!
languages.question: What does "tu" mean in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: Zero has caused a crisis among intellectuals. Lots of theologians in a row (cero) debated what zero meant.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for zero?

languages.mnemonic: He might have an amazing ability, but a bee wouldn't leave my dad (habilidad) alone.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "la habilidad" en inglés?

languages.mnemonic: You won't be able to get your camel through that narrow passage (capaz).
languages.question: What is the English translation of the Spanish word "capaz"?

languages.mnemonic: I read the news about the cat who was so brave (sobre).
languages.question: What does "sobre" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The armed police were on the rooftops above. They were there to arrest the really bad (arriba) men.
languages.question: What does "arriba" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: They told him to act his age – this actor was far too large (actuar) for the role.
languages.question: What is the English translation of the Spanish word "actuar"?

languages.mnemonic: The bull was a great actor (actor).
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el actor"?

languages.mnemonic: The actress wanted a leading role but was actually playing one of the trees (actriz).
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "la actriz"?

languages.mnemonic: I always add unnecessary items to my trolley at the supermarket (sumar).
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "sumar" mean?

languages.mnemonic: The plane moved quickly across the sky and beyond (avión) the horizon.
languages.question: ¿Qué es "el avión"?

languages.mnemonic: After seeing the film, the dog was desperate to appear in a western (después) film.
languages.question: What does "después" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: In the afternoon, she remembered it was tar-day (tarde) – when the workmen came to re-lay her drive.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa la tarde en español?

languages.mnemonic: It was against her principles to sign the contract (contra) but she felt she had no choice.
languages.question: What does the term "contra" mean?

languages.mnemonic: Given his age and experience, Grandad (edad) would be a great asset on our quiz team.
languages.question: ¿Cuál es la traducción de "la edad" al inglés?

languages.mnemonic: Years ago, I didn't have a say (hace) in how things were run but now I make the decisions.
languages.question: How would you translate the term "hace" in English when referring to time?

languages.mnemonic: I thought we had an agreement to do an activity where we don't (acuerdo) have to parachute.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa el término "el acuerdo"?

languages.mnemonic: The alarm went off when a llama (alarma) broke into my house.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "alarm"?

languages.mnemonic: Alarma is feminine, so it's la alarma. Imagine a lady pulling a fire alarm.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for alarm?

languages.mnemonic: All the people had to tow the doughnut (todo), they had already towed a (toda) pizza slice.
languages.question: What does "todo/toda" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: They wouldn't allow me in after they permanently banned me. I had tears (permitir) in my eyes.
languages.question: What is the meaning of the verb "permitir"?

languages.mnemonic: "I can play the triangle and also the tambourine", said the alien (también).
languages.question: What is the English translation of "también"?

languages.mnemonic: In the hallways (always) you could always see 'em pray (siempre).
languages.question: What does "siempre" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Walking among the guests, the waiter caught the man's toupee with the end of the tray (entre).
languages.question: What does "entre" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: And that is why cemetery has so many ee's (y).
languages.question: What does the conjunction "y" mean in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: He couldn't control his anger after his tenancy was ended. Now he had no home (enojo).
languages.question: What is the English translation of the Spanish word "enojo"?

languages.mnemonic: Enojo is masculine, so it's el enojo. Imagine an elephant with anger issues.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for anger?

languages.mnemonic: All the animals (animal) had a bull with them.
languages.question: What is the word for a living organism that typically feeds on organic matter?

languages.mnemonic: "Answer when I speak to you!" said the king as he tried to get his new parrot to talk. Its response was to poo on the court jester (respuesta).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "answer"?

languages.mnemonic: The ant cooked an awful meal that made me gag (hormiga).
languages.question: What is "la hormiga"?

languages.mnemonic: The parachute didn't appear when he pulled the cord, but luckily a parrot rescued him in mid-air (aparecer).
languages.question: What is the Spanish verb for "appear"?

languages.mnemonic: The farmer had to applaud a ploughing deer (applaudir).
languages.question: What does the French word "applaudir" mean?

languages.mnemonic: She had planned to just draw the apple, but she couldn't take her eyes off the man's anatomy (manzana).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for apple?

languages.mnemonic: Manzana is feminine, so it's la manzana. Imagine a lady whose adam's apple looks just like an apple.
languages.question: What is "la manzana"?

languages.mnemonic: I had an appointment with the doctor to see how this fake tan (cita) could be removed.
languages.question: What is the English translation of the Spanish word "cita"?

languages.mnemonic: Some people claim that with a pill (April) you can have a brilliant (abril) time.
languages.question: What is the English translation of "abril"?

languages.mnemonic: Are they committing arson (son)?
languages.question: What is a term for a male child?

languages.mnemonic: The target area was totally destroyed – the army had a ray gun that annihilated (aréa) everything.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el aréa"?

languages.mnemonic: On her arm were bras that she sold (brazo).
languages.question: What is "el brazo" in English?

languages.mnemonic: At around seven o'clock I start watching my favourite TV show. I watch about ten episodes a day (a eso de).
languages.question: ¿Cómo se traduce "a eso de" al inglés en el contexto de hablar sobre tiempo?

languages.mnemonic: They waited ages for their car to arrive and shouted "Yay! – here's the car" (llegar) as it finally drove into view.
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "llegar" mean?

languages.mnemonic: Their son was very good at art - after all, they were a very arty (arte) family.
languages.question: What is "el arte"?

languages.mnemonic: Art is masculine, so it's el arte. Imagine an elephant doing art, painting a picture in his studio.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for art?

languages.mnemonic: The artist only created art about Easter (artista).
languages.question: ¿Qué significa el término "el artista (m) / la artista (f)"?

languages.mnemonic: As expected, he looked like a much older man with his comb-over (como) hairstyle.
languages.question: What does "como" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: As smelly as a commode (como).
languages.question: What does "como" mean in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: I tried to ask the predator in the lagoon to stop targeting (preguntar) me, but it didn't work.
languages.question: What does "preguntar" mean?

languages.mnemonic: The ATM robbery was prevented as a super cartoon hero automatically (cajero automático) swooped down and stopped it!
languages.question: ¿Qué es un cajero automático?

languages.mnemonic: A gust of wind (August) blows us up into the sky just as I go to tow (agosto) the caravan.
languages.question: What is the English translation of "el agosto"?

languages.mnemonic: My aunt loves to wear a tiara (tia) where ever she goes.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for aunt?

languages.mnemonic: This baby better start betting (bebé) on the right numbers, or I'm ruined.
languages.question: What does "bebé" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Her back pain was caused by her best pal dancing (espalda) on her.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "la espalda" en inglés?

languages.mnemonic: In my backpack, I kept more cheese than would last (mochila) a lifetime.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "la mochila"?

languages.mnemonic: It had definitely gone bad – the marshmallow (malo) had mould growing on it!
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "bad"?

languages.mnemonic: Her bag was made of balsa (bolsa) wood, so broke easily when she dropped it.
languages.question: What is "la bolsa" in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: All of the bald people featured in this calendar wear bow (calvo) ties.
languages.question: What does the Spanish term "calvo" mean?

languages.mnemonic: The ball was caught by a pelican driving a smart motor (pelota).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for ball?

languages.mnemonic: I loved ballet, but I was so bad that they wouldn't let (balet) me dance.
languages.question: ¿Qué es el ballet?

languages.mnemonic: We went to see the band play, but we were banned from dancing (banda).
languages.question: What is "la banda" in English?

languages.mnemonic: Being covered in bandages, he couldn't bend at (venda) all.
languages.question: What is "la venda"?

languages.mnemonic: It was just his luck that the bank had decided to ban coins (banco) on the day he tried to pay in his savings.
languages.question: What does "el banco" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: This is the bull's favourite bar (bar).
languages.question: What is "el bar" in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: They were such a bargain that I bought the whole gang a (ganga) new pair of shoes.
languages.question: What is "la ganga" in English?

languages.mnemonic: The trick was anything but basic. It was a backflip into the sea out of a helicopter (básico).
languages.question: What is the meaning of "básico"?

languages.mnemonic: My shopping basket says tarts (cesta) will make me fat.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "basket"?

languages.mnemonic: The bull was terrible at basketball (básquetbol).
languages.question: What is básquetbol?

languages.mnemonic: When he went to bat, the batter tensed up when he saw the arms (batear) of the pitcher.
languages.question: ¿Qué acción describe el verbo "batear"?

languages.mnemonic: I wish you would be serious (ser), especially here Tarzan (estar).
languages.question: What do "ser" and "estar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: On the beach, the handle came off her bucket, but her dad had a pair of pliers (playa) to fix it.
languages.question: What does "la playa" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The bear was oh-so (oso) clever when it came to catching fish.
languages.question: What does "oso" mean in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: They beat him with a bat and he had tears (batir) in his eyes.
languages.question: What does the verb "batir" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: "Am I a beauty? Better say yes, absolutely (belleza)," she whispered to her friend.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for beauty?

languages.mnemonic: Belleza is feminine, so it's la belleza. Imagine a lady who uses so many beauty products she can hardly move around her house for them.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for beauty?

languages.mnemonic: Because the bee caused so much trouble, Porky (porque) pig fled the room.
languages.question: What does "porque" mean?

languages.mnemonic: Before he went to bed he would always set the security camera (cama) on.
languages.question: What does "la cama" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Cama is feminine, so it's la cama. Imagine a lady lying on a large, unusual bed.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "la cama"?

languages.mnemonic: Imagine your bedroom being turned into a dormitory (dormitorio) with lots of strange people sleeping in it.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el dormitorio"?

languages.mnemonic: Beer was all he was there for, so he declined when a man doing a survey of drinking habits said: "Survey Sir?" (cerveza)
languages.question: What is "la cerveza" in English?

languages.mnemonic: Before the ant was weak, now the ant tears (antes) a book in half with ease.
languages.question: What does "antes" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: "Begin! No more comments are (comenzar) allowed!"
languages.question: What is the meaning of the verb "comenzar"?

languages.mnemonic: Behind the garden fence I detect a rascal (detrás) rabbit eating my carrots and lettuce.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "behind"?

languages.mnemonic: I don't believe that flight will be going today: a big crevice has appeared in the aeroplane's (creer) wing.
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "creer" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: A bell ringing at the camp means it's time to eat a banana (campana).
languages.question: What is "la campana" in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: Every berry in my bag had been eaten by the yak (baya).
languages.question: What does "la baya" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: It is better to stay indoors today. There are menacing hordes (mejor) of wasps about.
languages.question: What does "mejor" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Between the skaters she entered on a tray (entre).
languages.question: What does the term "entre" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: While riding her bicycle, the bee sees a clever tactic (bicicleta) to speed herself up.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for bicycle?

languages.mnemonic: Bicicleta is feminine so it's la bicicleta. Imagine a lady worrying about getting her dress caught in a bicycle.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for bicycle?

languages.mnemonic: The big house was their family home - it was a grand day (grande) when they moved in.
languages.question: What does "grande" mean?

languages.mnemonic: The bill for the wine would have been extortionate so to quench our thirst we asked for tap (cuenta) water.
languages.question: What does "la cuenta" refer to in a restaurant setting?

languages.mnemonic: The little bird sat with the panda happily rowing (pájaro) on the lake.
languages.question: What is "el pájaro"?

languages.mnemonic: Bird is masculine, so it's el pájaro. Imagine an elephant with bird's wings, flying overhead.
languages.question: What does "el pájaro" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: You want me to bite into that? You'll have to give me more for that dare (morder).
languages.question: What does "morder" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: If you were sucked into a black hole, your neck would grow (negro) longer as your body is stretched.
languages.question: What does "el negro / la negra" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Around the giant block of ice was a naval blockade (bloque).
languages.question: What does "el bloque" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: As the blood poured from her cut, her new sandals weren't grey (sangre) anymore.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "la sangre"?

languages.mnemonic: She could blow soap bubbles so large (soplar).
languages.question: What is the Spanish verb for "to blow"?

languages.mnemonic: On the blue whale was a mermaid sitting on a stool (azul).
languages.question: ¿Qué color se representa con el término "el azul / la azul"?

languages.mnemonic: The crew board the plane, but already aboard are (abordar) the captain and his co-pilot.
languages.question: What does "abordar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: They don't call that a boat. They call that a barge carrying coal (barco).
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el barco"?

languages.mnemonic: On his body, he created a slot where post (cuerpo) goes in.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for body?

languages.mnemonic: The dogs bone was wedged under the sofa (hueso).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for bone?

languages.mnemonic: The book did a giant leap, landed on a bookcase and broke it (libro).
languages.question: What is "el libro"?

languages.mnemonic: Libro is masculine, so it's el libro. Imagine an elephant reading a book in a library.
languages.question: What is "el libro" in English?

languages.mnemonic: When the baby was born, nan came to see her dressed in a tuxedo (nacido).
languages.question: What does "nacido" mean?

languages.mnemonic: The boss is heavy and the stairs failed (jefe).
languages.question: Who does "el jefe" refer to in a workplace?

languages.mnemonic: Both said, "I am the boss" at the same time.
languages.question: What is the meaning of "ambos/ambas"?

languages.mnemonic: I bought a bottle of champagne on the boat to celebrate taking my yak (botella) on his first luxury cruise.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "bottle"?

languages.mnemonic: At the bottom of the pond lived a beautiful fish – she was very fond of it after over (fondo) 20 years living there.
languages.question: What does "el fondo" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Fondo is masculine, so it's el fondo. Imagine an elephant falling into the bottom of a ravine and getting trapped.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for "bottom"?

languages.mnemonic: Look at this bowl (bol) full of bulls.
languages.question: What is "el bol" in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: It was her tenth box of tissues – the catarrh (caja) was really bad.
languages.question: What does "la caja" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Caja is feminine so it's la caja. Imagine a lady sleeping in a box on the street.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "box"?

languages.mnemonic: The boy was angry that the cheetah was wearing his coat (chico).
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el chico"?

languages.mnemonic: The giant brain was celebrating until the referee said he'd broken (cerebro) the rules.
languages.question: ¿Cuál es la palabra en español para "brain"?

languages.mnemonic: I was clinging to the tree branch after I ran away from the massive (rama) dog.
languages.question: What does "rama" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The new brand is unremarkable (marca).
languages.question: What does "la marca" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: I cook my bread in a frying pan (pan).
languages.question: What does "el pan" mean in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: Pan is masculine, so it's el pan. Imagine an elephant baking a loaf of bread.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for bread?

languages.mnemonic: If you break that bed with all your romping, a repair (romper) will be very costly.
languages.question: What does the verb "romper" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: He couldn't breathe properly so they put him on an artificial respirator (respirar).
languages.question: What is the term for the action you engage in when you breathe in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: In bright sunshine, I ate brie with my aunt all day (brillante).
languages.question: What does "brillante" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: She couldn't bring herself to admit to a sudden release of trapped air (traer).
languages.question: What is the English translation of the Spanish verb "traer"?

languages.mnemonic: Her brother always said yes but her ma always said no (hermano).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for brother?

languages.mnemonic: Hermano is masculine, so it's el hermano. Imagine an elephant with an identical twin brother.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for "brother"?

languages.mnemonic: The brown chocolate left a mark on (marrón) my new dress.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for brown?

languages.mnemonic: To brush my hair will take several people; it's a hundred yards (cepillar) long.
languages.question: What does "cepillar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: I turned the bucket into a cool looking boat (cubo).
languages.question: What is the English translation of "el cubo"?

languages.mnemonic: In order to build you need the construction drawing to be true here (construir).
languages.question: What is the translation of "construir" from Spanish to English?

languages.mnemonic: Their building was completely edible, and they each feasted until the only (edificio) thing left was the front door.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for building?

languages.mnemonic: The bull told me to row (toro) faster.
languages.question: What is "el toro" in English?

languages.mnemonic: Be careful not to burn your arm on the kettle or it will mark (quemar) you permanently.
languages.question: What does "quemar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The bus driver told the passenger he'd throw him out of the bus (autobús) if he didn't behave.
languages.question: What does the term "autobús" refer to in English?

languages.mnemonic: His business made necklaces for goats; the only (negocio) problem was that he had no customers.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for business?

languages.mnemonic: They liked to keep busy, so they occupied themselves by cleaning the island of dodos (ocupado).
languages.question: What does "ocupado (m)/ocupada (f)" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: They thought they looked beautiful but really they looked like a pair of ogres (pero).
languages.question: What does "pero" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: If the Register Office were to buy a new computer system, the Registrar (comprar) would be able to update births and deaths far more efficiently.
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "comprar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: By having by-pass surgery, he hoped to improve his poor (por) health.
languages.question: What is the English translation of the Spanish preposition "por"?

languages.mnemonic: The cabbage attended college every day.
languages.question: What is "la col" in English?

languages.mnemonic: The café was a cybercafé with a terrier (cafeteria) dog serving behind the counter.
languages.question: What is another word for "Café"?

languages.mnemonic: The cakes were all passed to the telephone (pastel) to eat.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el pastel"?

languages.mnemonic: Why don't you answer when I call? Don't you want to speak to ya ma? (Llamar)
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "llamar" mean?

languages.mnemonic: This camel can make yoyos (camello) do amazing tricks.
languages.question: What is referred to as "camello" or "camella" in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: I prefer to camp in the mountains, as campsites are (acampar) too crowded.
languages.question: What is the verb in Spanish for "to camp"?

languages.mnemonic: This can of soup or this can of soup? I chose the latter (lata).
languages.question: What does "la lata" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: This candle is so much better than a lamp (bela).
languages.question: ¿Qué es la vela?

languages.mnemonic: The bull invested all its capital in the capital city's regeneration fund, but never got a penny in return.
languages.question: What is the difference between "el capital" and "la capital"?

languages.mnemonic: Imagine an elephant losing all his capital in an investment fraud.
languages.question: What is "el capital" in terms of monetary resources?

languages.mnemonic: Imagine a lady winning the election to be mayor of the capital city.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "la capital"?

languages.mnemonic: The ship's captain chased the cat after it peed on his tanning (capitán) lotion.
languages.question: What is the English translation of "el capitán"?

languages.mnemonic: The car broke down, but that doesn't mean we can't row (carro).
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el carro" en inglés?

languages.mnemonic: I received a birthday card from Tarzan. He needed help with the task (tarjeta) because he couldn't spell his name.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "card"?

languages.mnemonic: Tarjeta is feminine, so it's la tarjeta. Imagine a lady buying everything with her credit card.
languages.question: What is "la tarjeta" when referring to a form of payment?

languages.mnemonic: You carry all the yea votes because they are vast (llevar) and I'll carry the nay votes.
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "llevar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Llevar is feminine, so it's la llevar. Imagine a lady carrying a lady carrying a lady carrying a lady.
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "llevar" mean?

languages.mnemonic: The cashier lost count as the car hit the hedgerow (cajero).
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for "cashier"?

languages.mnemonic: The cat couldn't wait to eat some of the chocolate gateau (gato).
languages.question: What is the English translation of "el gato"?

languages.mnemonic: To catch them we laid a trap beneath the paratroopers (atrapar).
languages.question: What does "atrapar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The cause of climate change is that cows are (causa) producing methane gas.
languages.question: What does "la causa" mean?

languages.mnemonic: She wanted to celebrate, but she had no money, so decided to sell her bra (celebrar).
languages.question: What is the English translation of the Spanish verb "celebrar"?

languages.mnemonic: To clear out the centre of the town, they sent a troll (centro)
languages.question: What is the English translation of "centro" in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: My mum was certain she could see an aeroplane towing (cierto) a happy birthday banner.
languages.question: What does "cierto" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: She just wanted to sit in her easy chair all day so everyone else said "See-ya" (silla)
languages.question: What is "la silla" in English?

languages.mnemonic: There's a chance that this is the job opportunity I've been waiting for, but my dad (oportunidad) doesn't think so.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "la oportunidad"?

languages.mnemonic: Oportunidad is feminine, so it's la oportunidad. Imagine a lady with a chance of winning.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "la oportunidad"?

languages.mnemonic: Change into your warmest clothes, because our campsite will be in the arctic (cambiar).
languages.question: What is the meaning of the Spanish verb "cambiar"?

languages.mnemonic: The clown character arrived in the big top on a car roof rack and managed to tear (carácter) his baggy trousers as he jumped off.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "character"?

languages.definition: charge (verb), as in charge a fee
languages.mnemonic: The props department charge more for cobras because they are (cobrar) dangerous.
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "cobrar" mean?

languages.mnemonic: Making a chart was his task, but he handed in a blank (tabla) piece of paper.
languages.question: What is "la tabla" in English?

languages.mnemonic: I wrote a check to buy a cherry cake (cheque).
languages.question: What is "el cheque" in English?

languages.mnemonic: The inspectors' check on the school found the head had little control (control).
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for "check" as a noun?

languages.mnemonic: My cheese is kept so safe.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for cheese?

languages.mnemonic: The chef's food cost me next to nothing, but had zero (cocinero) flavour.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for chef or cook?

languages.mnemonic: Go to the chemist; a pharmacist will see the farmers ear (farmacia) and know how to treat it.
languages.question: What does "la farmacia" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The chick posed for his employee of the month photo (polito).
languages.question: What is "el pollito / la pollita"?

languages.mnemonic: This chicken rides a pony and yoyos (pollo).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for chicken?

languages.mnemonic: The child really needed to be in the yo-yo (niño) competition, said her mum, because she thought she was the best in the world.
languages.question: What does "niño/niña" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: This chocolate shop serves chocolate with a latte (chocolate) only.
languages.question: ¿Qué es el chocolate?

languages.mnemonic: Chocolate is masculine, so it's el chocolate. Imagine an elephant made of chocolate.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for chocolate?

languages.mnemonic: He will often choose to switch off his electronic hearing (elegir) aid so he didn't have to listen to the office chitter chatter.
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "elegir" mean?

languages.mnemonic: For Christmas, I received some nasty bees from Dad (navidad).
languages.question: ¿Qué se celebra durante la navidad?

languages.mnemonic: The church was perched on the top of a glacier (iglesia).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for church?

languages.mnemonic: At the cinema, you should have seen who was next (cine) to me!
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for cinema?

languages.mnemonic: Among his circle of friends, his theory that the world was cooling rated low (círculo).
languages.question: ¿Qué es un círculo?

languages.mnemonic: She was leaving the city and her dad for the first time. "See you Dad!" (ciudad) she said.
languages.question: What is the meaning of the Spanish word "ciudad"?

languages.mnemonic: She would claim first prize with her reckless ma (reclamar).
languages.question: What does the verb "reclamar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The class groaned as their teacher told them they were having a test on the classic novel, Sense (clase) and Sensibility by Jane Austen.
languages.question: What does "la clase" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: They had to clean the gallery from top to bottom after the lemur did a pee all over the artwork (limpiar).
languages.question: What is the Spanish verb for "to clean"?

languages.mnemonic: Exposed to the clear blue skies in the desert, she desperately had to go (despejado) and find water.
languages.question: What kind of weather is described by the term "despejado"?

languages.mnemonic: It was clear by the classy way she rode (claro) to victory that she was a great jockey.
languages.question: What does "claro" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The climate in the valley was very rainy, so they had to clean Ma (clima) up when she arrived back home.
languages.question: What does "el clima" refer to?

languages.mnemonic: Once we climb to the top of this mountain Superman will give us a cold beer (subir).
languages.question: What does the verb "subir" mean?

languages.mnemonic: There were clocks everywhere on the railway's oldest locomotive (reloj).
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el reloj" en inglés?

languages.mnemonic: At the close of the ceremony, the pirates shouted "Arr!" (cerrar).
languages.question: What is the Spanish verb for "close"?

languages.mnemonic: To clothe my large family I will have to sell my best steer (vestir) at market.
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "vestir" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Instead of clothes, she coiled a long rope (ropa) around herself.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for clothes?

languages.mnemonic: A huge cloud came over and there was a violent storm – then they saw that a new bay (nube) had formed where the shore had been washed away.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "la nube"?

languages.mnemonic: In the cloudy water of the pond, his new toy boat sank (nubosa).
languages.question: What does "nuboso" or "nubosa" mean when describing a liquid?

languages.mnemonic: He thought it was just cloudy weather but it was nuclear blast damage (nublada).
languages.question: What does "nublado / nublada" mean in terms of weather?

languages.mnemonic: To live by the coast can cost a (costa) lot of money.
languages.question: What does "la costa" refer to in English?

languages.mnemonic: You'll need a coat on a cold, breezy day like this, so go (abrigo) and find one.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el abrigo"?

languages.mnemonic: They were desperate for coffee, but unfortunately the cafe (café) had run out.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el café"?

languages.mnemonic: Café is masculine, so it's el café. Imagine drinking coffee out of an elephant mug.
languages.question: What is "el café"?

languages.mnemonic: It was so cold her hand stuck to the car door handle - it took a lot of antifreeze to free her (fria).
languages.question: What does "frio" or "fria" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: I need to collect some long hair to make a wig. Can you recommend a hair (recoger) salon locally?
languages.question: What is the meaning of the verb "recoger"?

languages.mnemonic: The colony in the arctic found it cold and lonely living near (colonia) the North Pole.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for colony?

languages.mnemonic: Colonia is feminine, so it's la colonia. Imagine a colony exclusively for ladies.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for colony?

languages.mnemonic: The colour of the cup's floral (color) design was very bright.
languages.question: What is the meaning of "el color"?

languages.mnemonic: On top of the column was a koala with a bloom of flowers. She shared them with my nan (columna).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "column"?

languages.mnemonic: This comb causes pain every (peine) time I use it.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for comb?

languages.mnemonic: Come see the veneered (venir) woman!
languages.question: What does the French verb "venir" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: It's not common to see a comet hit the moon (común).
languages.question: What does the Spanish word "común" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The company was run by the empress and (empresa) the emperor.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "la empresa"?

languages.mnemonic: Compare these two combat forces. I think the parrot army (comparar) has the edge.
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "comparar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: These paintings really complement our home. I've had many compliments on the artwork (complementar).
languages.question: What does it mean to "complementar" something?

languages.mnemonic: It was a complete disaster – she complained it was on her toe (completo) but no one could hear her.
languages.question: What does "completo" (m) or "completa" (f) mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The computer needed a complete reboot so that the adorable (computadora) robot it controlled would work.
languages.question: What is la computadora in English?

languages.mnemonic: The equipment was in poor condition, and I confronted the deep-sea diving instructor on (condición) it.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "la condición"?

languages.mnemonic: The driver was also a conductor – he waved his baton while driving the bus.
languages.question: Who is referred to as the conductor?

languages.mnemonic: I connect cola bottle caps to make necklaces, and it's starting (conectar) to catch on.
languages.question: What does "conectar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Consider a considerably large "R" (considerar).
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "considerar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: She couldn't contain her joy when she found out that the contents of the box were aeroplanes (contener).
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "contener" mean?

languages.mnemonic: While in the continent of Asia, you can consume tea in linen table (continente) restaurants.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "continent"?

languages.mnemonic: I'll continue to contain this teenager because there's a warrant (continuar) for her arrest.
languages.question: What does the verb "continuar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: To control the flow of aircraft at airports, traffic controllers are (controlar) key.
languages.question: What does "controlar" mean in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: I hope I remain cool at the fresher's disco (fresco).
languages.question: What does "el fresco" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Fresco is masculine, so it's el fresco. Imagine an elephant keeping cool in a freezer.
languages.question: What does "el fresco" mean in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: It's easy to copy if you have a photocopier (copiar) machine.
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "copiar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: I fed corn to Ma's geese (maíz).
languages.question: ¿Qué es el maíz?

languages.mnemonic: Turning a corner, the Eskimo spotted a hyena (esquina), so quickly aimed his harpoon.
languages.question: What is "la esquina"?

languages.mnemonic: Give correct answers to all of the questions to win the jackpot. Each correct answer (correcta) is worth £1,000.
languages.question: What does "correcto" or "correcta" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The shopping trip cost me a fortune because my toe (costo) caught a glassware display and all the breakages had to be paid for!
languages.question: ¿Cuál es el término en español para "cost"?

languages.mnemonic: Costo is masculine, so it's el costo. Imagine an elephant that cost a lot of money.
languages.question: ¿Cuál es el significado de "el costo"?

languages.mnemonic: My white cotton sheets were ruined; I shouldn't have allowed the goat and donkey (algodón) on my bed.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for cotton?

languages.mnemonic: He agreed to count them all before considering how many stars (contar) there are.
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "contar" mean?

languages.mnemonic: Whenever we visit another country, Pa takes it easy (país).
languages.question: What does "el país" translate to in English?

languages.mnemonic: This course is making me curse so (curso) much. I hate it!
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "course"?

languages.mnemonic: To cover the hole in her jeans, she sewed a cube on her rear (cubrir).
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "cubrir" mean?

languages.mnemonic: The cow tried to back the car (vaca) into the garage.
languages.question: What is the translation of "la vaca" in English?

languages.mnemonic: Vaca is feminine, so it's la vaca. Imagine a lady riding a cow.
languages.question: What is "la vaca"?

languages.mnemonic: The Lord wanted to create a new family crest, so an artist (crear) was employed to design one.
languages.question: What is the Spanish verb for "to create"?

languages.mnemonic: When they cross the road, chickens don't appreciate cruel or sarcastic (cruzar) comments.
languages.question: What is the meaning of "cruzar"?

languages.mnemonic: The crowd weren't booing; they were mooing. A multitude (multitud) of cows were in the audience.
languages.question: What is the meaning of the word "multitud"?

languages.mnemonic: She started to cry because the yoke was rather (llorar) hard - she liked her eggs runny so she could dip her bread.
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "llorar" mean?

languages.mnemonic: On the edge of my cup the Tasmanian devil sat (taza).
languages.question: What is "la taza" in English?

languages.mnemonic: The customer must clean as they enter then they can take (cliente) a seat.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for customer?

languages.mnemonic: They cut it open and its core was full of tar (cortar)!
languages.question: What does the Spanish word "cortar" mean?

languages.mnemonic: Dad made a living as one of the paparazzi (papá).
languages.question: What does "el papá" mean?

languages.mnemonic: "Why are all my clothes damp?" – "Oops, I slept in the meadow" (húmedo).
languages.question: What does "húmedo" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: They dance so well they are tipped to win the contest by a large (bailar) margin.
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "bailar" mean?

languages.mnemonic: Danger signs when the pelican grows (peligro) angry are the raising of her wings and the snapping of her beak.
languages.question: What does "peligro" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: We painted them dark brown. The Oscars look cool all in a row (oscuro) painted dark brown instead of gold.
languages.question: What does "oscuro (m)/oscura (f)" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: My daughter eats handfuls (hija) of sweets.
languages.question: ¿Cómo se dice "daughter" en español?

languages.mnemonic: Day dawns, and here's your first cup of tea of the day, dear (día).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for day?

languages.mnemonic: The dead man was wearing a toga (muerto).
languages.question: What does "muerto" mean in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: My dear grandmother wants to keep reading, so don't (querido) disturb her.
languages.question: What is the English translation of "querido"?

languages.mnemonic: You'll have an early death if you move where bombs are tested (muerte).
languages.question: What does "la muerte" mean?

languages.mnemonic: Muerte is feminine, so it's la muerte. Imagine a lady narrowly avoiding death.
languages.question: What does "la muerte" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: At Christmas (December), I like to go deep-sea fishing and embrace (diciembre) the cold weather.
languages.question: ¿Cuál es el mes en español conocido como diciembre?

languages.mnemonic: If you decide to go to the ocean's depths, you may see a deer (decidir).
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "decidir" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: His knowledge is deep - although he professes to be a buffoon, don't (profuno) underestimate him.
languages.question: What does "profundo/profunda" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: When it's forty degrees Celsius outside, my gran will doze (grado) in the shade.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for the unit of measurement known as a degree?

languages.mnemonic: The dentist gave me new dentures; now each one of my teeth has been replaced with a star (dentista).
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el/la dentista" en inglés?

languages.mnemonic: I depend on my deputy to make sure my enemies dare (depender) not attack me from behind.
languages.question: What does the verb "depender" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Can you describe what happened? Yes, I was eating my dessert when a man with a cream shirt and a black beard (describir) stole it.
languages.question: How do you say "describe" in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: In the desert, I was desperate for water but all I could see was a pair of toads (desierto).
languages.question: What is "el desierto"?

languages.mnemonic: What a design! It's a decent-sized radio (diseño) too!
languages.question: What is the meaning of "el diseño"?

languages.mnemonic: The dessert has gone - who could possibly have taken it off the tray (postre).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for dessert?

languages.mnemonic: "It's difficult to determine the day they'll tear me open" said the banana (determinar).
languages.question: What does "determinar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: I checked the dictionary for the right word, and I declare that the man I see over there is a nasty lothario (diccionario).
languages.question: What is "el diccionario" in English?

languages.mnemonic: The panda cubs will not die – as long as their mother rears (morir) them well!
languages.question: What does the verb "morir" mean?

languages.mnemonic: It was difficult to defeat the seal (difícil) at volleyball.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa la palabra "difícil"?

languages.mnemonic: If we dig, we can go under the barbed (cavar) wire fence.
languages.question: What is the meaning of the verb "cavar"?

languages.mnemonic: The direct attack by the dog left him with a deformed wreck of a toe (directo).
languages.question: What is the English translation of "directo/directa"?

languages.mnemonic: Although they're dirty, the sui ts I see the o gre (sucio) wear are fantastic.
languages.question: What does "sucio" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: We need to discuss my destroyed scooter. You steered (discutir) directly into it!
languages.question: What does the Spanish term "discutir" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: She remained distant from one side of the family because of her distrust of her aunty (distante).
languages.question: What is the meaning of "distante"?

languages.mnemonic: We could divide the room into those who decided that the beer was too dear (dividir) and those who didn't.
languages.question: What is the English translation of the Spanish verb "dividir"?

languages.mnemonic: Why do you have to keep waking me up? Can't you find a different girl to serenade? (hacer).
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "hacer" mean?

languages.mnemonic: The doctor thought the medicine was correct (médico), but the patient responded badly.
languages.question: What is the role of a "médico"?

languages.mnemonic: The little dog tried to hide in the pear row (perro).
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for "dog"?

languages.mnemonic: "The lad done well" was etched over (hecho) the top of the stone of the football star's grave.
languages.question: What is the English translation of the Spanish word "hecho"?

languages.mnemonic: The donkey said "Boo!" to the roman (burro).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for donkey?

languages.mnemonic: Outside the door there was a smell of poo in the air from the tank (puerta) of manure at the nearby farm.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for door?

languages.mnemonic: Puerta is feminine, so it's la puerta. Imagine a picture of a lady, painted on a door.
languages.question: What is "la puerta" in English?

languages.mnemonic: I wasn't seeing double, both of the dogs were carrying blades (doble).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "double"?

languages.mnemonic: My favourite thing to draw is a deer in boots playing a harmonica (dibujar).
languages.question: ¿Cómo se dice "draw" en español?

languages.mnemonic: I used to dream that I had sewn a world made of yarn (soñar).
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "soñar" mean?

languages.mnemonic: You must wear a smart dress because this is the best tea house in the world, so don't (vestido) wear shabby clothes.
languages.question: What does "vestido" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: I drink the best beer when my dad (bebida) isn't looking.
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "bebida" translate to in English?

languages.mnemonic: Don't let her drive, this manager has written half (manejar) our cars off.
languages.question: What is the Spanish verb for "drive"?

languages.mnemonic: The bus driver conducted a spooky tour (conductor).
languages.question: Who is referred to as "el conductor" or "la conductora"?

languages.mnemonic: Drop down, the goats are (gota) coming.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "drop"?

languages.mnemonic: You play the drum, and I'll play the tambourine (tambor).
languages.question: What is "el tambor" in English?

languages.mnemonic: It will be dry for the next few days, said the weather forecast: within seconds clouds came over (seco) and it rained.
languages.question: What does "seco" (m)/"seca" (f) mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: You can't serve duck pâté; that's totally (pato) insensitive.
languages.question: What does "pato/pata" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: During work you can guarantee he will do a rant every day (durante).
languages.question: What is the English translation of the Spanish word "durante"?

languages.mnemonic: Each of the wizards said abracadabra (cada), and they each made a different animal appear.
languages.question: What does the Spanish word "cada" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: It's a joy to my ear - that beautiful organ recital music makes me so happy (oreja).
languages.question: What does "la oreja" refer to in English?

languages.mnemonic: Early in her career, the teacher would lose her temper with the soprano (temprano) student.
languages.question: What does "temprano" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The Earth shed tears over the errors (tierra) humans were making.
languages.question: What is "la tierra"?

languages.mnemonic: What's best to ease a headache? I think the best ways to alleviate are (aliviar) aspirin or paracetamol.
languages.question: What is the verb in Spanish for "to ease"?

languages.mnemonic: If we trade with the East, I estimate (este) it's worth billions.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for "East"?

languages.mnemonic: Eating on this commercial airline (comer) was never going to be possible.
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "comer" mean?

languages.mnemonic: He drives us over the edge - we have to listen to the old bore all day (borde).
languages.question: What is the meaning of "el borde" in English?

languages.mnemonic: Tom paused for dramatic effect. It was amazing how the special effects team had enlarged his toe (efecto). Efecto is masculine, so it's el efecto. Imagine an elephant shown through special-effect hologram.
languages.question: What is "efecto" in English?

languages.mnemonic: She always cracked her egg on a whale bone (huevo) that she kept for that very purpose.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el huevo" en inglés?

languages.mnemonic: The hungry eight-legged spider opened the chocolate (ocho) bar.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for eight?

languages.mnemonic: His bid to get around the world in eighty days was in jeopardy – the border guards said his coach could not enter (ochenta).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for eighty?

languages.mnemonic: The electrics were turned on by the electrician and the tree cafe (eléctrica) lit up!
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "electric"?

languages.mnemonic: The eleven-man team of footballers who lost the match still had to attend an online therapy session (once).
languages.question: What is the number word that rhymes with "sconce" and relates to an eleven-man team attending therapy online?

languages.mnemonic: Is there anything else, before you have your massage (más), that I need to know?
languages.question: What does "más" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: At the end of the safari tour, the visitors are charged a fee for every animal they've seen (fin).
languages.question: What does "el fin" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Fin is masculine, so it's el fin. Imagine an elephant crying at the end of a sad film.
languages.question: What is "el fin" in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: My enemy's enemy won't go (enemigo) away!
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "enemy"?

languages.mnemonic: His energy has run out. To boost his energy he accepts (energía) a chocolate bar.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for energy?

languages.mnemonic: The engine on the boat will make too much noise - they will have to cross the moat using oars (motor).
languages.question: ¿Qué es el motor?

languages.mnemonic: She liked the English so much, she put a giant Englishman, in glaze (inglés) outside her house.
languages.question: What does "inglés/inglesa" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: I can't get enough of the sun! I will bask until I tan, even if I stay (bastante) all day.
languages.question: What does "bastante" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: I always enter a room in an entertaining way rather (entrar) than just walking in.
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "entrar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The envelope looks scary, so be brave (sobre) and open it.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el sobre"?

languages.mnemonic: Equal to the challenge was the iguana who was bilingual (igual).
languages.question: What does the term "igual" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Our hotel gives excellent service, especially to a special guest who's meant to stay (especialmente) in the best room.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "especially"?

languages.definition: even (adverb) - used to show that something is surprising
languages.mnemonic: Even Sherlock Holmes is asking if I've seen any clues, so (incluso) it must be a complex case.
languages.question: What does "incluso" mean when used as an adverb?

languages.mnemonic: I don't remember the event because I spent the entire time bent over (evento) looking for my glasses.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el evento" en inglés?

languages.mnemonic: Evento is masculine, so it's el evento. Imagine an event just for elephants.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el evento"?

languages.mnemonic: Every day, a deer with a trio (a diario) of birds on its antlers come into my garden to sing.
languages.question: What does "a diario" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Every cadaver (cada) has medical students around them.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "every"?

languages.mnemonic: The exact weight of your eggs should match the exact amount (exacta) of your other ingredients for the perfect sponge cake.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "exact"?

languages.mnemonic: They looked exactly the same, had the exact same clothes, and wouldn't let men take (exactamente) them on dates.
languages.question: What does "exactamente" translate to in English?

languages.mnemonic: Here is an example of a hemmed pillow (ejemplo) sewn very badly.
languages.question: What does the Spanish term "ejemplo" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Ejemplo is masculine, so it's el ejemplo. Imagine an elephant being used as an example of a household pet.
languages.question: What is "el ejemplo"?

languages.mnemonic: Except you! You can't go. I'll make an exception because of your toe (excepto).
languages.question: What is the meaning of the Spanish word "excepto"?

languages.mnemonic: You excite me when, around your neck, I see a guitar (excitar).
languages.question: What is the Spanish verb for "excite"?

languages.mnemonic: When you exercise, ensure your hair is tied; otherwise you might have to see a physio (ejercicio).
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for exercise?

languages.mnemonic: Ejercicio is masculine, so it's el ejercicio. Imagine an elephant doing so much exercise he's perspiring and out of breath.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "ejercicio" en español?

languages.mnemonic: She ran for the exit whilst eating the salad, leaving her dad (salida) with the bill.
languages.question: What does "la salida" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The police didn't know what to expect as the escaped pair entered the arcade (esperar) brandishing their weapons.
languages.question: What does "esperar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: It was an experience I'd never forget. An experimental rocket re-entered the atmosphere and crashed through my roof. You can now see a (experiencia) huge hole in it!
languages.question: ¿Qué significa la palabra "experiencia" en español?

languages.mnemonic: He got a poke in the eye with an old hoe (ojo).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "eye"?

languages.mnemonic: Despite being made from fabric, the television (tela) worked.
languages.question: What is "la tela"?

languages.mnemonic: I decided to have my face painted on the side of my caravan (cara). Cara is feminine, so it's la cara. Imagine a portrait gallery and the face in every picture is a lady's.
languages.question: What is "la cara" in English?

languages.mnemonic: Imagine a factory entirely devoted to making fabric for a car (fábrica).
languages.question: What is the English translation of "fábrica"?

languages.mnemonic: This isn't fair! Whose tax (justa) bill am I paying? There's got to be a mistake!
languages.question: What does the term "justo/justa" mean in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: The fall caused the cat to drop through the air (caer) for a mile.
languages.question: What does "caer" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: In the Fall the leaves of the oak create tones that must be videoed (otoño).
languages.question: What does "el otoño" mean?

languages.mnemonic: The family didn't flinch when grandma took up pole-dancing: they were familiar (familia) with her ways.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "family"?

languages.mnemonic: This famous family are oh-so-talented (famoso).
languages.question: What is the meaning of "famoso" or "famosa"?

languages.mnemonic: It's not that far, let me carry you to the hospital (lejos).
languages.question: What does "lejos" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: We don't go to the farm anymore, not since Gran lost her hat there (granja)!
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "farm"?

languages.mnemonic: You'll become fat if you gorge on doughnuts (gordo).
languages.question: What is the meaning of the Spanish word "gordo"?

languages.mnemonic: She was surprised to find her father dressed as a padre – she hadn't known he was going to a fancy dress party.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "father"?

languages.mnemonic: They favor the fastest boat when rescuing their (favorecer) stranded friend.
languages.question: What does "favorecer" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: It was their favorite holiday location and they went there every year, but they had to travel far for a burrito (favorito).
languages.question: What does the Spanish word "favorito" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: I fear they won't let me enter the donut (miedo) shop.
languages.question: What does "el miedo" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Their water supply was fed by a brewery (February), so every St Valentine's Day they bathed in beer and ate Ferrero (febrero) Rocher chocolates.
languages.question: ¿Cuál es el mes febrero en inglés?

languages.mnemonic: Go feed the alley men who are under the tarpaulins (alimentar).
languages.question: What does "alimentar" mean?

languages.mnemonic: I didn't feel very well, so I was sent here (sentir) to see the doctor.
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "sentir" mean?

languages.mnemonic: A few men are brave enough to poke cobras (poco) with their fingers. Women think it's more sensible to use a stick as a poker (poca).
languages.question: What does "poco" or "poca" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The field was full so they had to camp over (campo) the road.
languages.question: What is the English translation of "el campo"?

languages.mnemonic: Campo is masculine, so it's el campo. Imagine an elephant having a field all to itself.
languages.question: What does "el campo" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The game was fifteen-love. They were keen to win this set (quince) as it would take them to the final.
languages.question: What is the English translation of the Spanish word "quince"?

languages.mnemonic: She had a fifty-fifty chance of survival. The scenery was baron, and she had no water to quench her thirst. It would be a tough task (cincuenta) to get out of the desert.
languages.question: What does "cincuenta" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: They had to fight to use the loo on the charter (luchar) flight.
languages.question: What does the verb "luchar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: To fill a vase with a generous array of sunflowers was the artist's objective (llenar).
languages.question: What does "llenar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Can you find the end of the contract (encontrar).
languages.question: What does the verb "encontrar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: I broke my finger giving a demo at a judo (dedo) club.
languages.question: What is "dedo" in English?

languages.mnemonic: They will never finish cleaning all the glass at the airport terminal because the windows are (terminar) endless.
languages.question: What does "terminar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The fire was halfway up her leg before she decided to go (fuego) and jump into the lake.
languages.question: What is "el fuego"?

languages.mnemonic: To be first, she had to pray she stayed on the mare (el primero). When he got over the finish line the pretty mare was such a poser (la primera).
languages.question: What does "el primero / la primera" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The fish in the water were a pest (pez).
languages.question: What does "la pez" refer to in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: That fish was a pesky carp but I don't (pescado) care because I'm now going to eat it.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el pescado"?

languages.mnemonic: I love to fish but this pesky carp (pescar) keeps getting away from me!
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "pescar" mean?

languages.mnemonic: In the Indy 500 race, one of the drivers was cleaning the end of their toes (quinientos).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for five hundred?

languages.mnemonic: He high-five'd the plumber who stopped his sink from overflowing (cinco).
languages.question: What does "cinco" mean in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: The floor was covered in his suede loafers (suelo).
languages.question: What does "suelo" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: They seemed to flow through the sky - strange creatures that flew using their ears (fuir) as wings.
languages.question: What does "fluir" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The flower he tried to impress her with ended up on the floor (flor).
languages.question: What does "la flor" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Chasing a fly is a favourite hobby of most cats (mosca).
languages.question: What is "la mosca"?

languages.mnemonic: Mosca is feminine, so it's la mosca. Imagine a lady swatting a huge fly.
languages.question: What does the term "la mosca" refer to in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: You can fly with a bowler hat – but it has to be large (volar).
languages.question: What does "volar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The flying boat landed on my table (volante).
languages.question: What does the term "volante" mean?

languages.mnemonic: The fog was so thick I nearly blacked (niebla) out when I hit my head on a wall.
languages.question: What is "la niebla" in English?

languages.mnemonic: Niebla is feminine, so it's la niebla. Imagine a lady appearing out of the fog.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "la niebla"?

languages.mnemonic: Fold your clothes and don't blast (doblar) out your music.
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "doblar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: If you want to follow me up the mountain, you'll need several more gears (seguir) on your bike.
languages.question: What does the verb "seguir" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Food was thrown at the comedian (comida).
languages.question: What is "la comida"?

languages.mnemonic: The foot of my new PA (pie) was on my head – it wasn't the best start.
languages.question: What does "el pie" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: What is this pull-cord for? To open your parachute (para) of course.
languages.question: What does "para" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The force of the flood took me somewhere new; now I'm sat (fuerza) on the top of a pyramid.
languages.question: What is the English translation of "la fuerza"?

languages.mnemonic: The weather forecast was terrible. This prognosis meant we wore tea cosies (pronóstico) to stay warm.
languages.question: What does "pronóstico" mean in terms of weather?

languages.mnemonic: She was on great form at the party until she spotted her former (forma) partner with his new girlfriend.
languages.question: What does the Spanish term "la forma" mean?

languages.mnemonic: Forma is feminine so it's la forma. Imagine a lady in a strange form.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for "form"?

languages.mnemonic: It rained for forty days and nights. Quasimodo charged rent at (cuarenta) the top of Notre Dame Cathedral.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for forty?

languages.mnemonic: We moved forward in a daze after we landed, taking (adelante) our first steps on this alien world.
languages.question: What is the meaning of the Spanish term "adelante"?

languages.mnemonic: It looked like a four-leaf clover had won the quad bike trophy (cuatro) race.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for the number four?

languages.mnemonic: On the fourteenth of February the room was all prepared for Valentine's day until the cat tore the set (catorce) of bed sheets.
languages.question: What does "catorce" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The fox felt sorrow (zorro) when no one came to his birthday party.
languages.question: What is the English translation of "el zorro"?

languages.mnemonic: The free samples of Gran's teas (gratis) were going quickly.
languages.question: What does "gratis" mean?

languages.mnemonic: You're going to freeze in that t-shirt; we're expecting large (helar) amounts of snow and ice.
languages.question: What does the verb "helar" mean?

languages.mnemonic: The artist painted a fresh fruit fresco (fresco) on the wall.
languages.question: What does the term "fresco" mean in Italian?

languages.mnemonic: Friday is the day work finishes and we go straight down to the bar - beer's nice (viernes) there.
languages.question: What day of the week is "viernes" in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: If your fridge is being raided, never stop a bear from getting a (nevera) meal!
languages.question: What is "la nevera" in English?

languages.mnemonic: My friend and me go (amigo) everywhere together.
languages.question: What does "amigo/amiga" mean?

languages.mnemonic: I went with my friend to a restaurant but they gave me such a meagre (amiga) portion.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for a female friend?

languages.mnemonic: The frog ran a (rana) marathon.
languages.question: What is "la rana" in English?

languages.mnemonic: From the middle of the desert, she demanded (desde) a three-course meal.
languages.question: What does the Spanish word "desde" translate to in English?

languages.mnemonic: Fruit? The only way to eat it is as a fruit tart (fruta).
languages.question: What is "la fruta" in English?

languages.mnemonic: The room was full of yellow Post-It notes (lleno).
languages.question: What does "lleno" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: It was fun with the deer and the bear, drinking tea and eating doughnuts (divertido).
languages.question: What does "divertido" mean in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: Because this was the funeral director's wake, the food would be at the funeral (funeral) parlour.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el funeral" en inglés?

languages.mnemonic: It was so funny. My gran couldn't see over the wall so (gracioso) she used stilts.
languages.question: What does "gracioso" mean in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: In the future all food must be served with two roses (futuro), said the Queen.
languages.question: What does "el futuro" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: I want to watch the football game at the party, but they don't (partido) want to.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el partido"?

languages.mnemonic: The game of darts is the decider, whoever wins goes (juego) through to the final.
languages.question: What is the translation of "el juego" in English?

languages.mnemonic: My garage was guaranteed to be full of hay (garaje).
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el garaje"?

languages.mnemonic: Her garden was full of hardy (jardin) annuals.
languages.question: What is the French word for garden?

languages.mnemonic: This dish needs garlic - a whole (ajo) bulb of it.
languages.question: ¿Qué es el ajo?

languages.mnemonic: As a general rule this hen lays several (general) eggs a week.
languages.question: What is the term for something that is common or widespread?

languages.mnemonic: A gentle breeze blew and the gentleman looked very suave in the bay (suave).
languages.question: What does suave mean?

languages.mnemonic: The crops are going to get wet, we need to get most of the harvest in to save (mojarse) it before it's ruined.
languages.question: What does "mojarse" mean in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: He gave the girl a kiss on the cheek and (chica) ran!
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "girl"?

languages.mnemonic: Give me a kiss, darling (dar).
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "dar" mean?

languages.mnemonic: He was glad that she was still content despite him accidentally (contenta) flooding their house.
languages.question: What is the meaning of the Spanish word "contento" (m) or "contenta" (f)?

languages.mnemonic: I dropped my glass as I moved from the bar, so (vaso) I had to buy another drink.
languages.question: What is "el vaso" in English?

languages.mnemonic: Wear a glove when feeding this iguana, or it'll take (guante) your finger off.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for "glove"?

languages.mnemonic: Guante is masculine, so it's el guante. Imagine an elephant wearing a glove.
languages.question: What does "el guante" mean in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: "Go!" Immediately the ear (ir) was in front.
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "ir" mean?

languages.mnemonic: A goat stole a cab, and the driver ran (cabra) after it.
languages.question: What does "la cabra" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: God was so annoyed when he lost a race against the ostrich (dios), he put a curse on it, so it could no longer fly.
languages.question: What is the translation of "dios" from Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: Gold was used to make the ornaments that stood in a row (oro).
languages.question: What does "el oro" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The bull enjoys playing golf (golf). Note: The bull is a Spanish icon, and whenever you see it on our images, it means that the word sounds similar in both English and Spanish.
languages.question: What is the sport that is the same in both English and Spanish in terms of name, often associated with a course featuring 18 holes?

languages.mnemonic: Golf is masculine, so it's el golf. Imagine an elephant playing golf.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el golf"?

languages.mnemonic: They were enjoying the good life – but when oh when (bueno) would their hens start laying eggs?
languages.question: What does "bueno" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Before saying goodbye to the patient, the nurse agreed to add a dose (adiós) so that she would sleep better.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for goodbye?

languages.mnemonic: The goose joined a gang so (ganso) it would get more respect.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for "goose"?

languages.mnemonic: The Government official was accused of being loudmouthed, but gobby, er no (gobierno) – he just had to deliver his advice.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "Government"?

languages.mnemonic: Now my grandfather has great abs, but he used to weigh loads (abuelo).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for grandfather?

languages.mnemonic: My grandmother was absolutely wasted last (abuela) night!
languages.question: What is "la abuela" in English?

languages.mnemonic: As he cut the grass, he erred badly (hierba) and cut off his toes with the mower.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for grass?

languages.mnemonic: Hierba is feminine so it's la hierba. Imagine a lady wearing a grass dress.
languages.question: What is "la hierba" in English?

languages.mnemonic: The gray on my overalls was grease (gris).
languages.question: What does "el gris/ la gris" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: My great gran (gran) just turned 100 but still enjoys skydiving.
languages.question: What does "gran" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The green grass is nice and cool. I like to walk barefoot on a hot day (verde) to cool my feet down.
languages.question: What does "verde" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The wedding group picture had to be taken quickly as storm clouds grew and posed (grupo) a real threat.
languages.question: What does "grupo" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: He would grow cress instead of hair (crecer).
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "crecer" mean?

languages.mnemonic: They don't just guess where they are; in a deep-sea vehicle, they use the beep of sonar (adivinar).
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for "guess"?

languages.mnemonic: I had to guide the geese through the art (guiar) gallery.
languages.question: What is the meaning of the verb "guiar"?

languages.mnemonic: Brandishing a gun, the pea stole a (pistola) car.
languages.question: What is "la pistola" in English?

languages.mnemonic: Hair was her area of expertise – even though the pay was low (Pelo).
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el pelo"?

languages.mnemonic: Half a glass of water will help this medicine go (medio) down.
languages.question: What does "medio (m) / media (f)" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: They will shut you down in half an hour. This government can meddle with the news, media or a (media hora) popular website.
languages.question: What does "media hora" mean?

languages.mnemonic: Half man - half beast – meet goliath (mitad), the main attraction at the circus.
languages.question: What does the Spanish term "mitad" refer to in English?

languages.mnemonic: He raised his hand to let his Ma know (mano) he could see her in the crowd.
languages.question: What does "mano" mean in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: Should a big fish happen to pass a sardine (pasar), it might swallow it whole.
languages.question: What does the verb "pasar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: It would make me really happy if we went. So, can we go to the fair, please? (feliz).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for happy?

languages.mnemonic: The bread was hard, there was nothing she could do but throw (duro) it away.
languages.question: What does "duro (m)/dura (f)" mean in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: He owned many types of hats, including a sombrero (sombrero)
languages.question: What is a sombrero?

languages.mnemonic: Sombrero is masculine, so it's el sombrero. Imagine an elephant wearing a hat.
languages.question: What is a sombrero?

languages.mnemonic: I have ten aeroplanes (tener).
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "tener" mean?

languages.mnemonic: He was startled when he woke up and saw that he'd grown an elephant (él) trunk.
languages.question: What does "él" mean in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: I've used my head! For this car I've bought the best satnav (cabeza) available.
languages.question: What is "la cabeza" in English?

languages.mnemonic: She put her fantastic health and fitness down to the fact that salad was the only food (salud) she ate.
languages.question: What does "salud" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: His heart stopped in the cold of the Arctic marathon (corazón).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for heart?

languages.mnemonic: Providing heat with just a candle was against the law (calor) she thought.
languages.question: What does "el calor" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Calor is masculine, so it's el calor. Imagine an elephant warming itself in the heat of an open fire.
languages.question: What does "el calor" refer to?

languages.mnemonic: On our picnic, we get caught in a heavy shower just as we were about to chew on our bass coated (chubasco) in breadcrumbs.
languages.question: What does "el chubasco" refer to?

languages.mnemonic: Chubasco is masculine, so it's el chubasco. Imagine an elephant in a heavy shower.
languages.question: What is el chubasco?

languages.mnemonic: There were heavy odds against victory - a pessimist sighting the armada (pesada) might have been more concerned.
languages.question: What does "pesado/pesada" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: If you aren't the correct height, you won't be allowed to rap (altura).
languages.question: What is "la altura" in English?

languages.mnemonic: Altura is feminine, so it's la altura. Imagine a lady who is terrified of heights.
languages.question: What does "la altura" refer to in English?

languages.mnemonic: Hola rhymes with cola. Imagine saying hello to someone and pouring them a cola (hola) drink as a way of welcoming them.
languages.question: What does "hola" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The soldiers only wore helmets when attacking the castle, as cola (casco) cans were being thrown at them from the castle walls.
languages.question: What does "el casco" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Help! Are you any good at darts (ayudar)?
languages.question: What does "ayudar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: "Here! Come here!" he shouted, and the dog came bounding back with a key (aquí) – it was a giant one!
languages.question: What does "aquí" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: In the male voice choir, the high notes are sung by alto (alto) singers.
languages.question: What does the term "alto" mean in music?

languages.mnemonic: After running up and down the hill several times a day, the koalas were much leaner (colina).
languages.question: ¿Qué significa la colina?
