languages.mnemonic: They had his and her suits (su).
languages.question: What does "su" mean in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: History is easy – you could start with Queen Victoria (historia).
languages.question: What is the meaning of the term "historia"?

languages.mnemonic: Historia is feminine, so it's la historia. Imagine a lady that's gone back in history.
languages.question: What is the feminine word for history in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: She hit the golf ball so hard it broke a pane in the art (golpear) gallery a quarter of a mile away.
languages.question: What does the Spanish word "golpear" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: They had hold of the man as he rescued the mountaineer (mantener).
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "mantener" mean?

languages.mnemonic: My home has an ogre guarding (hogar) the entrance.
languages.question: What does "el hogar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: To meet this bull was an honor (honor).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "honor"?

languages.mnemonic: He lived in hope – he was especially interested in her answer (esperanza).
languages.question: What does "la esperanza" mean?

languages.mnemonic: The horse took a cab to buy some oats (caballo).
languages.question: What does "el caballo" mean in English?

languages.definition: A building where people receive medical care.
languages.mnemonic: The injured bull was taken to hospital.
languages.question: What is a hospital?

languages.mnemonic: In the hotel, a bull was checking in!
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el hotel" en inglés?

languages.mnemonic: She spent a magical hour in the palace, captivated by its aura (hora).
languages.question: What is "la hora" in English?

languages.mnemonic: On my house, you can see I'm a massive fan of 'Casablanca' (casa) because there is a mural of Humphrey Bogart and Ingrid Bergman on the side.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for house?

languages.mnemonic: Casa is feminine, so it's la casa. Imagine a lady shaped house.
languages.question: What is "la casa" in English?

languages.mnemonic: She just wanted to know how - she hadn't intended to cause a commotion (cómo)
languages.question: What does "¿cómo?" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: It's huge! The enor-mous cake I ma-de (enorme) is bigger than a house!
languages.question: What does the Spanish term "enorme" mean?

languages.mnemonic: All the humans turned as the woman walked by. "That woman is oh (humano) so beautiful."
languages.question: ¿Cuál es el término en español para "human"?

languages.mnemonic: Celebrating one hundred years, you should see the entrance (cien) of the theatre decorated with flowers and balloons.
languages.question: What does "cien" mean in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: The hunt for a job wasn't going well, so the busker kept dancing (búsqueda) and singing to earn a few pennies.
languages.question: What does "búsqueda" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: "Could you hurry up with the ceremony?" "No," said the priest, who wanted to finish his sax (prisa) solo.
languages.question: What does "prisa" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: My husband exposes so (esposo) much of his bum when he works.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el esposo"?

languages.mnemonic: I like yo-yos (yo).
languages.question: What is the Spanish pronoun for "I"?

languages.mnemonic: Give an ice cream to the excellent lad over (helado) there.
languages.question: What is "helado"?

languages.mnemonic: Helado is masculine, so it's el helado. Imagine an elephant made of ice cream.
languages.question: What is "helado"?

languages.mnemonic: The ice on the pond has turned yellow (hielo) - I wonder why?
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for ice?

languages.mnemonic: His idea was to redate a (idea) batch of food that had passed it's use-by date.
languages.question: What does "la idea" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Idea is feminine, so it's la idea. Imagine a lady announcing a great idea to a boardroom of boring men.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "idea"?

languages.mnemonic: If I was taller, I might be able to see (si) the football match.
languages.question: What does "si" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: His father was suffering from a serious illness. He said: 'It's unfair me dad (enfermedad) has to suffer like this'.
languages.question: What does the term "enfermedad" mean?

languages.mnemonic: Imagine each man here snarling (imaginar) at one another.
languages.question: What does the term "imaginar" mean?

languages.mnemonic: It's important that we import ants able (importante) to build houses.
languages.question: What does the Spanish term "importante" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: In the envelope there was a large sum of cash!
languages.question: What does "en" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: He lost an inch off this finger - that's what can happen if you pull the guard off a (pulgada) power tool.
languages.question: What is the measurement unit known as pulgada?

languages.mnemonic: Pulgada is feminine so it's la pulgada. Imagine a lady having an inch cut off her hair.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for inch?

languages.mnemonic: Include this person, said the quest master in the computer game because I've seen a clue in his ear (incluir) that will help you in your quest.
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "incluir" mean?

languages.mnemonic: There was an increase in the number of our men who were tarred and feathered for not bowing to the king.
languages.question: What does "aumentar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: To indicate her dislike of him, she wrote an indecent message on his car (indicar).
languages.question: What does the Spanish term "indicar" mean?

languages.mnemonic: A serious injury resulted when a reader (herida) at the library removed a large book from the shelf.
languages.question: What does "la herida" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The toad taunted the insects, singing "eeny, meeny, miny, moe, catch an insect by its toe" (insecto).
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el insecto" en inglés?

languages.mnemonic: The instant that teenager stands on the wobbly table (instante), it'll fall over.
languages.question: What does the Spanish term "el instante" mean?

languages.mnemonic: Instante is masculine, so it's el instante. Imagine an elephant becoming an instant success.
languages.question: What is "el instante"?

languages.mnemonic: I was trying to hold my instrument up when the instrument fell over (intrumento).
languages.question: What is the English translation of the Spanish word "instrumento"?

languages.mnemonic: They couldn't help but show an interest in her because the teen looked like an extra-terrestrial (interés).
languages.question: What does the Spanish term "interés" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The young man invents pointless products; the teenager is currently working on a bendy guitar.
languages.question: What does the term "inventar" mean?

languages.mnemonic: Iron Man was outside cooking a barbecue on a large griddle. Lots of meat was being cooked because he planned to have a big charity (plancha) event.
languages.question: What does "la plancha" refer to in cooking?

languages.mnemonic: I bought myself a new iron, my old one still works so I plan to donate it to a charity (plancha) shop.
languages.question: What is the English translation of "la plancha"?

languages.mnemonic: "Is it me you're looking for?" he asked. She decided to make a quick escape (es).
languages.question: What is the English translation of the Spanish word "es"?

languages.mnemonic: The island was very small, so it would not be easy to land (isla) the plane.
languages.question: What does "la isla" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Isla is feminine, so it's la isla. Imagine a lady stranded alone on a desert island.
languages.question: What does "la isla" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The janitor (January) had a huge clear up operation when an aero plane (enero) crashed into the grounds of the building he looked after.
languages.question: What month is referred to as "enero" in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: For my job I travel a lot, but the best journey is when I travel back home (trabajo).
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el trabajo"?

languages.mnemonic: Trabajo is masculine, so it's el trabajo. Imagine an elephant clocking in for his job at a factory.
languages.question: What does "el trabajo" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: When you join our holiday club, you get a souvenir (unir) from every destination we go to.
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "unir" mean?

languages.mnemonic: The joy of her night turned to drunkenness - she later alleged the sangria (alegría) had been spiked.
languages.question: What does the Spanish term "alegría" mean?

languages.mnemonic: Alegría is feminine, so it's la alegría. Imagine a lady full of joy on her wedding day.
languages.question: What does "alegría" mean?

languages.mnemonic: The orange juice threw the sumo (zumo) wrestler over its head.
languages.question: What does "el zumo" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: He's due a lie down (July) – but whose leotard (julio) is that?
languages.question: What is the English equivalent of "julio"?

languages.mnemonic: I can now jump since I've been on salads and stopped eating jam tarts (saltar).
languages.question: What does "saltar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The dune (June) was big, but who could know (junio) it would take a day to travel over it?
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el junio"?

languages.mnemonic: In the jungle, orangutans sell baguettes (selva).
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "la selva"?

languages.mnemonic: "Just one question, who's toe (justo) is in my drink?"
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "just"?

languages.mnemonic: He was trying to keep his luscious locks but now the man has only got ten hairs left (mantener).
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "mantener" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: I need the key to lock the door to the back yard, a bear's (llave) got in there!
languages.question: What does "la llave" mean in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: Llave is feminine, so it's la llave. Imagine a lady with a giant key around her neck.
languages.question: What is "la llave"?

languages.mnemonic: The kill at bullfights has ceased in many areas but the matador's artistic (matar) display is still the main feature.
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "matar" mean?

languages.mnemonic: The bull lost ten kilos (kilo) on the diet.
languages.question: What is the term that refers to weight, often quantified in thousands of a base unit?

languages.mnemonic: King Henry VIII had six wives and reigned (rey) over England for 36 years.
languages.question: What is the meaning of "el rey" in English?

languages.mnemonic: The kitten loves gateaux, and can eat a (gatita) whole one.
languages.question: What is the English translation of "gatito/gatita"?

languages.mnemonic: I injured my knee while rodeo riding a yak (rodilla).
languages.question: ¿Qué parte del cuerpo es la rodilla?

languages.mnemonic: He bought a knife with a coupon. It was cheap, and Yoda (cuchillo) didn't like it.
languages.question: What is "el cuchillo"?

languages.mnemonic: I know where the sad bear (saber) is. Let's cheer her up.
languages.question: What does the verb "saber" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Did you know that convict over there keeps staring (conocer) at us?
languages.question: What is the Spanish verb for "to know"?

languages.mnemonic: A lady is causing a scene in reception. I've sent your assistant (señora) to escort her out of the building.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for "lady"?

languages.mnemonic: The lake was guarded by a la rge go lden (lago) eagle.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el lago"?

languages.mnemonic: While holding a lamp, the lamb parachuted (lámpara) down.
languages.question: ¿Qué es la lámpara?

languages.mnemonic: In this strange land, teapots fly through the air with raccoon (tierra) pilots.
languages.question: What does "la tierra" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Our language is full of idioms: my Ma (idioma) always says things like "Break a leg" and "Under the weather".
languages.question: What is meant by "idioma"?

languages.mnemonic: Last night, they had to over-tip the taxi driver with a note because they had no change (anoche).
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "anoche"?

languages.mnemonic: "This is the last time!" she gave him an ultimatum (última) over his heavy drinking: give it up or leave.
languages.question: What does the Spanish term "último" or "última" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: I was late so they tarred me and left me all day (tarde) tied to the lamp post.
languages.question: What does "tarde" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The horse had a laugh every time I had to resaddle (risa). Laugh is feminine, so it's la risa. Imagine a lady having a real belly ache laugh.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for a laugh (noun)?

languages.mnemonic: She was a law student, but she didn't learn much because she lay (ley) in bed most of the day.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for "law"?

languages.mnemonic: The lawn's great, just watch for the cesspit ahead (césped).
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el césped" en inglés?

languages.mnemonic: The lawyer had a boa that guarded a (abogada) door.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for a male or female lawyer?

languages.mnemonic: I want to lay that colourful carpet (colocar) on my stairs.
languages.question: What does the verb "colocar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The bull was a natural leader (líder).
languages.question: What does "líder" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: To learn the trade, you start as an apprentice but don't you dare (aprender) cut corners.
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "aprender" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Her least favourite job at the barbers was trimming men's nostril (menos) hair.
languages.question: What does "menos" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: "Leave, immediately! You've put the salad in your ear (salir)."
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "salir" mean?

languages.mnemonic: Let's go left, this skiing instructor dared her (izquierda).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "left"?

languages.mnemonic: My leg was sunburnt after sitting on the pier having a nap (pierna)
languages.question: ¿Qué parte del cuerpo se refiere la palabra "pierna"?

languages.mnemonic: The lemon was leaping over the monster (limón).
languages.question: What is "el limón" in English?

languages.mnemonic: The entire length of the ship was filled with very large cargo (largo).
languages.question: What does "el largo" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Largo is masculine, so it's el largo. Imagine measuring the length of a line of elephants.
languages.question: What does "el largo" refer to in terms of measurement?

languages.mnemonic: She wanted less hassle so took an easier job. Her main loss (menos) was financial, but she felt she gained in other ways.
languages.question: What does "menos" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The only reason she lets him play is that she's practically deaf and can't hear his awful harp (dejar) playing!
languages.question: What does "dejar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: He thought he had received a love letter but really it was the car tax (carta).
languages.question: What does "la carta" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Carta is feminine, so it's la carta. Imagine a lady writing a love letter.
languages.question: What does "la carta" mean in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: I experienced a high level of pain after being kneed in the belly (nivel).
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el nivel"?

languages.mnemonic: The reference library had a whole section on bible texts (biblioteca) because it was run by the church.
languages.question: What does "la biblioteca" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: She is going to lie and say she saw the men in tears (mentir) when she declined to go out with them but the truth is she'd never been asked out.
languages.question: What does the verb "mentir" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Life is just as precious for animals as it is for us, says my vegan dad (vida) and he let all his animals go free.
languages.question: What does "la vida" mean?

languages.mnemonic: Vida is feminine, so it's la vida. Imagine a lady being sentenced to life by a judge.
languages.question: What does "la vida" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: He tried to lift my presents into the trees, so let's ban Tarzan (levantar) from the party.
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "levantar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: We need more light to get that loose (luz) tooth out.
languages.question: What does "la luz" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Lightning struck me under the red street lamp; I was in agony (relámpago).
languages.question: ¿Qué significa la palabra "el relámpago"?

languages.mnemonic: Relámpago is masculine, so it's el relámpago. imagine an elephant shooting lightning from it's trunk.
languages.question: What does "el relámpago" refer to?

languages.mnemonic: This incredibly low speed limit leaves me taking (límite) hours to get to work.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for "limit"?

languages.mnemonic: On the washing line hangs lots of linen ears (línea). Línea is feminine, so it's la linea. Imagine a line of ladies walking a slack-line.
languages.question: What does "la línea" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: If lions lay on (león) you, remain perfectly still.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for lion?

languages.mnemonic: The liquid was coming through the leaky door (liquido).
languages.question: What is "liquido" in English?

languages.mnemonic: The billionaires made a list of places with the least tax (lista), so they could decide where to move.
languages.question: What is "la lista" in English?

languages.mnemonic: Lista is feminine, so it's la lista. Imagine a list of famous ladies.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "list"?

languages.mnemonic: We listened on the estate to the cuckoo's charming (escuchar) call.
languages.question: What is the Spanish verb for "listen"?

languages.mnemonic: The little boy learnt not to poke the ogre (poco).
languages.question: What does "poco" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Since he went to live in the pub, the bee's favourite drink was beer (vivir).
languages.question: What is the Spanish verb that means "to live"?

languages.mnemonic: The living room was turned into a hairdressing salon (salón).
languages.question: What is "el salón" in English?

languages.mnemonic: When we locate them we will lower the cargo, which leaves the army (lacalizar) with the tanks they need.
languages.question: What does "localizar" mean?

languages.mnemonic: The lone wolf was a solitary figure moving over (solitario) the scrubland.
languages.question: What does "solitario (m)/solitaria (f)" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: This was the longest lager (larga) she'd ever attempted to drink.
languages.question: What does "largo (m)/larga (f)" mean in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: "Look for the booster seat for the car! Can you see it anywhere?"
languages.question: What does the verb "buscar" mean?

languages.mnemonic: They weren't lost, the pair of deer were looking for a doe (perdido).
languages.question: What does "perdido" or "perdida" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: There is one loud voice in our choir, the alto (alto) in the back row drowns everyone else out.
languages.question: What does "alto / alta" mean in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: I love you in your armour more (amor).
languages.question: What does the term "amor" mean?

languages.mnemonic: The bridge was too low so he couldn't get back home (bajo).
languages.question: What is the meaning of the Spanish word "bajo"?

languages.mnemonic: My loyal dog stays up late and sounds the alarm (leal) if he hears anything.
languages.question: What does "leal" mean?

languages.mnemonic: It may seem like pure luck, but I swear it takes (suerte) skill.
languages.question: What is "la suerte"?

languages.mnemonic: After sorting all this mail, I think the company really owes (correo) me a raise.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for mail?

languages.mnemonic: Correo is masculine, so it's el correo. Imagine an elephant receiving mail.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for mail?

languages.mnemonic: The main character was a pirate with a parrot on his shoulder, who he called his preening sea pal (principal).
languages.question: What does "principal" mean?

languages.mnemonic: The man ate his meal as normal – even though they had served his omelette in a beret (hombre).
languages.question: What does the Spanish word "hombre" mean?

languages.mnemonic: We manufacture fabric cars (fabrica).
languages.question: What is the English translation of the Spanish word "fabricar"?

languages.mnemonic: The map confused my Ma and Pa (mapa) - we were well and truly lost.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el mapa"?

languages.mnemonic: It wasn't a normal map. This map actually (mapa) led to buried treasure!
languages.question: What is "el mapa" in English?

languages.mnemonic: Mapa is masculine, so it's el mapa. Imagine an elephant reading a map on a walk.
languages.question: ¿Qué es "el mapa"?

languages.mnemonic: Don't march through here; it marks the floor so (marso) badly.
languages.question: ¿Cuál es el mes de marzo en inglés?

languages.mnemonic: At the market for cars, he bought a car but he had to say: "Me car don't go!" (mercado).
languages.question: What does "mercado" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: There was too much mass. The fat man sank (masa) the boat.
languages.question: What does "la masa" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: As she's a master of the written word, ma's essay won the trophy (maestro).
languages.question: What does the term "maestro" or "maestra" mean?

languages.mnemonic: Different materials had been used to make different Spanish bulls.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el material" en inglés?

languages.mnemonic: Material is masculine, so it's el material. Imagine an elephant also made of different materials.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el material"?

languages.mnemonic: It didn't matter to her that she wasn't famous - it wasn't important to be a star (importar).
languages.question: What does "importar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: I danced around the maypole (May) with my yo-yo (mayo).
languages.question: What does "el mayo" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Me? I'd like to be the mayor (me).
languages.question: What word refers to oneself, often used by someone speaking about themselves?

languages.mnemonic: I didn't mean to cause significant damage to your car (significar). It was an accident.
languages.question: What does the verb "significar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: They measure everything in your medical, even the length of your ears (medir).
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "medir" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Meat is the main diet of carnivores (carne) like wolves and mountain lions.
languages.question: What does the term "carne" mean?

languages.mnemonic: It was a haunting melody that she mellowed to and held dear (melodía) for the rest of her singing career.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "la melodía"?

languages.mnemonic: We waited for a menu for so long, we thought the waiter had gone by car or taxi (carta) to fetch it.
languages.question: What is "la carta" in a restaurant setting?

languages.mnemonic: Carta is feminine, so it's la carta. Imagine a lady holding a menu the wrong way up and saying she can't understand it.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "menu"?

languages.mnemonic: The bull was made of metal.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el metal"?

languages.mnemonic: The method to stop toes being damaged on building sites is to use metal toecaps which don't (método) allow them to be crushed.
languages.question: What is "método" in English?

languages.mnemonic: At midday, because it was so hot, the men took a swim in the deep ocean; it was a bad idea (mediodia).
languages.question: What time of day does "mediodia" refer to?

languages.mnemonic: My middle child is the only one that doesn't want to be a medic out of the trio (medio).
languages.question: What does "medio / media" mean in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: At midnight, you must check his pills. Last night, the meds he had were not checked (madianoche) and he turned into a werewolf.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "la medianoche"?

languages.mnemonic: Medianoche is feminine, so it's la medianoche. Imagine a lady running from the ball at midnight like Cinderella.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "la medianoche"?

languages.mnemonic: It was mild weather but the temperature was dropping as a large tornado (templado) approached.
languages.question: What does the Spanish term "templado" describe in terms of weather?

languages.mnemonic: It's a 'Trust the customer Milk Bar' – you take your drink then lay some change (leche) on the bar.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for milk?

languages.mnemonic: Take the word million and mill the word out except the two L's leaving mi ion (millón).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for million?

languages.mnemonic: I was a million miles from anywhere – just me on (millón) a mountain.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "million"?

languages.mnemonic: If he's even a minute late meeting me at noon I'll stamp on his toe (minuto).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "minute"?

languages.mnemonic: Minuto is masculine, so it's el minuto. Imagine an elephant timing itself standing on one foot for a minute.
languages.question: ¿Qué término en español se utiliza para "minute", usando la forma masculina?

languages.mnemonic: This mirror was especially large in this home (espejo).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for mirror?

languages.mnemonic: Miss! Can you please send your heater (señorita) to me?
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for "Miss"?

languages.mnemonic: She decided to mix different languages. Her message needed clarification.
languages.question: What does "mezclar" mean in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: This cell phone they are trying to sell you is too large (celular).
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el celular"?

languages.mnemonic: He wanted a modern car as his old motor was now derelict and no (moderno) longer ran.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "modern"?

languages.mnemonic: One moment it was sunny, the next moment the skies opened (momento) and down came the rain.
languages.question: What is the English translation of "momento" in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: Momento is masculine, so it's el momento. Imagine an elephant having a moment of madness and demolishing a house.
languages.question: What is the translation of "momento" in English?

languages.mnemonic: On Monday mornings, this is how we all turn up for work, dressed as 'loonies' (lunes).
languages.question: What day of the week is referred to as "lunes"?

languages.mnemonic: With all your money, dear Nero (dinero) please stop playing the violin and help rebuild the city.
languages.question: What is "dinero"?

languages.mnemonic: Dinero is masculine, so it's el dinero. Imagine an elephant printing his own money.
languages.question: What is "el dinero" in English?

languages.mnemonic: The monkey on the moped has no (mono) license.
languages.question: What does "mono" mean in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: They got the months in a complete mess (mes) on the calendar.
languages.question: What does "el mes" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: He swore the moon was talking to him - his friends thought he was a lunatic (luna).
languages.question: What does "la luna" refer to in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: More devout you couldn't get – she went to mass (más) three times every Sunday.
languages.question: What does "más" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: In the morning I get up for the special day when all long-haired men have to donate for man yarn (mañana) day.
languages.question: What does "mañana" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The mother was angry with the mad ray (madre) for attacking her daughter.
languages.question: What does "madre" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: If you go on the mountain make sure you monitor the tan on ya (montaña).
languages.question: What is "la montaña"?

languages.mnemonic: With her mouth wide open, she showed her surprise at receiving a bouquet and card (boca) for Valentine's Day.
languages.question: What does "la boca" refer to?

languages.mnemonic: Boca is feminine, so it's la boca. Imagine a lady with a very large mouth.
languages.question: What is la boca in English?

languages.mnemonic: I moved to a town where everyone had mauve hair (mover).
languages.question: What is the Spanish verb for "to move"?

languages.mnemonic: I made quick movements and avoided most of the bees, but a mean one stung the end of my toe (movimiento).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "movement"?

languages.mnemonic: Movimiento is masculine, so it's el movimiento. Imagine an elephant's movements being tracked by motion capture.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for "movement"?

languages.mnemonic: The movie is about a pelican who's cooler (película) than anyone else.
languages.question: What does "la película" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: How much did you make the cow moo? Are you sure you chose (mucho) the right prodding stick?
languages.question: What does "mucho/mucha" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: If you multiply 10 by 2, that's how many cars he's got. The multi-millionaire looks very pleased with his new sports car (multiplicar).
languages.question: What does "multiplicar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: It was listening to music, so the moose didn't see the car (mùsica) coming.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for music?

languages.mnemonic: You must defend the bears (deber) from Goldilocks.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for "must"?

languages.mnemonic: He was wearing a fake mustache, so the bee told the goat to take (bigote) it off.
languages.question: What is "el bigote"?

languages.mnemonic: My favourite portrait is this one of me (mi)!
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "my"?

languages.mnemonic: The name of my nomination for bravest (nombre) person in the world is...
languages.question: What does "nombre" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: This nation is a nasty place to go on (nación) holiday.
languages.question: What is the English translation of "nación"?

languages.mnemonic: Why did they organise it near the library? The military ceremony involved one hundred cannons (cerca).
languages.question: What does "cerca" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Is it necessary to sit next to several punks? It's my worst case scenario (necessario).
languages.question: What is the English translation of "necessario"?

languages.mnemonic: I have neck pain after seeing a questionable yoga (cuello) instructor.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for neck?

languages.mnemonic: If you need to see him, then it's necessary to see Tarzan's (necesitar) mum first.
languages.question: What does "necesitar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Using a needle and thread, a goose has (aguja) patched up my clothing.
languages.question: What does the Spanish word "aguja" translate to in English?

languages.mnemonic: My neighbour likes to be seen as (vecina) the richest person in the street.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for "neighbour"?

languages.mnemonic: In her nest, the bird kneads dough (nido).
languages.question: What is the meaning of "el nido"?

languages.mnemonic: In my net, I caught a red (red) fish.
languages.question: What is the English translation of "la red"?

languages.mnemonic: You'll never see him before noon, he's a night cat (nunca).
languages.question: What does the Spanish word "nunca" mean?

languages.mnemonic: It wasn't really new, even though they described their sound as new wave (nuevo).
languages.question: What does the Spanish term "nuevo" mean?

languages.mnemonic: The news crews are waiting for the celebrity, but he's hoping no one notices (noticias) him as he walks by.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for news?

languages.mnemonic: He used newspapers to make a house in the woods during his period as an eco (periódico) warrior.
languages.question: What is a periódico?

languages.mnemonic: Next year we need approximately (Próxima) twice our sales to stop us going bust!
languages.question: What is the English translation of "próximo/próxima"?

languages.mnemonic: Night came, but there was no change (noche) in the temperature – it was still so hot.
languages.question: What does "la noche" mean in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: Noche is feminine, so it's la noche. Imagine the shape of a lady in the sky at night.
languages.question: What does "la noche" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The cat with nine lives trembled as she carefully crossed the nuclear weapon base (nueve).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for nine?

languages.mnemonic: To go through ninety degrees you go from no bent arm (noventa) to a bent arm.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for ninety?

languages.mnemonic: It was definitely a "No" from the bull.
languages.question: What is the opposite of "yes"?

languages.mnemonic: Making a loud noise is rude when we are dozing (ruido).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for noise?

languages.mnemonic: Ruido is masculine, so it's el ruido. Imagine an elephant making a loud noise.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el ruido"?

languages.mnemonic: At noon she takes her medicine and spills it – it's all over you, dear! (mediodía)
languages.question: What does "el mediodía" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: My nephew doesn't like me, nor does my niece (ni).
languages.question: What does "ni" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: To get to our home in the North we normally take (note) the scenic route.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for North?

languages.mnemonic: Imagine an elephant shivering in the North Pole.
languages.question: What is "el norte" in English?

languages.mnemonic: He blew his nose on a napkin full of grease (nariz).
languages.question: What does "la nariz" mean?

languages.mnemonic: Nariz is feminine, so it's la nariz. Imagine a lady with a giant nose.
languages.question: ¿Qué parte del cuerpo en español se llama la nariz?

languages.mnemonic: The note on the packet said there was no tar (nota) in the cigarettes, but her cough was as bad as ever.
languages.question: What does "la nota" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Nothing could stop my nan from dancing (nada).
languages.question: What does "nada" mean?

languages.mnemonic: Notice how the gravel on the road flies everywhere because there is no tar (notar) laid on the road yet.
languages.question: What does "notar" mean?

languages.mnemonic: The supernova was one to remember (November). No beam of light, ember or ray could be brighter (noviembre).
languages.question: ¿Cuál mes en español es "noviembre"?

languages.mnemonic: Now is not the time to show people you have a massive aura (ahora).
languages.question: What does "ahora" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: There were a number of bowls of noodles the mayor ate in a row (número). It was a massive amount.
languages.question: What is the term in Spanish for "number"?

languages.mnemonic: We couldn't make out what the object was until we got closer, then it was obvious: a hen attacking a toad (objeto).
languages.question: What does "el objeto" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: He didn't observe the rules so, even though he objected, they wouldn't serve him and he was barred (observar).
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "observar" mean?

languages.mnemonic: Fox attacks will occur. They will climb over the chicken coop's rear (occurir) fence.
languages.question: What is the English translation of the Spanish verb "ocurrir"?

languages.mnemonic: In this vast ocean, there is only one sailboat. There are no (océano) others.
languages.question: What is the English translation of "océano"?

languages.mnemonic: The octopus (October) could get through the octagonal tube to see her friend the ray (octubre).
languages.question: ¿Cuál es el mes en español que corresponde a octubre?

languages.mnemonic: An octopus is in my pool posing (pulpo).
languages.question: What is "el pulpo" in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: Of all the things he was afraid of, going to the dentist (de) was by far the worst.
languages.question: What is the English translation of the Spanish word "de"?

languages.mnemonic: Your offer is far too low. It's only fair that you tack (oferta) on a few more zeros.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "la oferta"?

languages.mnemonic: Oferta is feminine, so it's la oferta. Imagine a lady accepting a dream job offer.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "la oferta"?

languages.mnemonic: He has an unusual mode of transport to the office – sometimes he gets off his hyena outside, other times he rides it right up to his desk.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "office"?

languages.mnemonic: You'll often find that Americans love new types of doughnuts (a menudo).
languages.question: What does "a menudo" mean?

languages.mnemonic: The oil made the athlete slip. I say take (aceite) more care and go around it.
languages.question: What is "aceite" in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: Aceite is masculine, so it's el aceite. Imagine an elephant slipping on oil while trying to hold on to everything around him.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for oil?

languages.mnemonic: The old vehicle had a hole (viejo) in it.
languages.question: What does "viejo" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: He would start on time, but after the teenage musician's tempo (a tiempo) sped up, the conductor couldn't control him.
languages.question: What does "a tiempo" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Once upon a time, the moon decided to wear an undergarment: you could say it was a lunar vest (una vez).
languages.question: What does "una vez" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: She has won (one) every game of uno (uno) she has ever played.
languages.question: What number does "uno" represent?

languages.mnemonic: It was the only wound of its kind the doctor had ever seen: blood oozed from his knee which had swollen into a big cone (único).
languages.question: What does "único/única" mean as an adjective?

languages.mnemonic: The aeroplane flew only inches above their heads - it was so low (sólo) they felt they could have reached up and touched it.
languages.question: What does "sólo" mean in Spanish when used as an adverb?

languages.mnemonic: You could open up a war if you confirm your partner has a big rear (abrir).
languages.question: What does the verb "abrir" mean?

languages.mnemonic: To operate the curtains at the opera, you need strong arms (operar).
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "operar" mean?

languages.mnemonic: I starred opposite an opera singer in the West End; it was a total (opuesto) dream come true.
languages.question: What is the English translation of the Spanish word "opuesto"?

languages.mnemonic: Would you like an apple or an orange? (o).
languages.question: What does the term "o" mean in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: The orange tiger started an attack and they ran harder (anaranjada) than they ever had before.
languages.question: ¿Cuál es el color "el anaranjado/la anaranjada"?

languages.mnemonic: She was eating an orange when her nan rang her (naranja) so she was unable to speak for a moment.
languages.question: What does "la naranja" refer to in English?

languages.definition: Order as in: To give an order, to order, to sort, to command.
languages.mnemonic: My order, ordinarily (ordenar), is fish and chips, but today I'll just forget it.
languages.question: What does "ordenar" mean in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: He decided to order a surprise present for his wife, a new pet, a reindeer (pedir)! What will she say.
languages.question: What does "pedir" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: When I said I would organise an organic diet, I was being sarcastic (organizar).
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "organizar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: It was an original idea; the only real issue he had was that it would be criminal (original).
languages.question: What does the adjective "original" mean?

languages.mnemonic: The others looked on in envy as the clever otters rowed (otro (m)) down stream in their canoe.
languages.question: What does "el otro (m), la otra (f)" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The other otters ran (otra (f)) alongside.
languages.question: What is the translation of "el otro (m), la otra (f)" in English?

languages.mnemonic: Here is our newest troll (nuestro), Mike.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "our"?

languages.mnemonic: I'm going out like this because I'm not afraid of wearing a (afuera) leotard in public.
languages.question: What is the meaning of the Spanish term "fuera/afuera"?

languages.mnemonic: I need to get this oven working, or no (horno) one will eat.
languages.question: What is a "horno" in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: I owe you a debt of gratitude. You were the only one that dared to stop the bear (deber).
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "deber" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: I gave the owl some new boots, and she was overjoyed (búho).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "owl"?

languages.mnemonic: Even in your own apartment, it's inappropriate to pee over (propio) the side of the balcony.
languages.question: What does "propio" mean in terms of ownership?

languages.mnemonic: The owner of the dwelling got pneumonia (dueña) because it was a cold and damp place.
languages.question: What does "el dueño (m)/ la dueña (f)" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Using oxygen tanks, the ox goes deep-sea diving with a hare that knows (oxigeno) the way.
languages.question: ¿Qué es "el oxígeno"?

languages.mnemonic: The pages were being ripped out of the book by pa's hyena (página).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "page"?

languages.mnemonic: He said he could relieve her pain but it would cost her a dollar (dolor)
languages.question: What is "el dolor" in English?

languages.mnemonic: They would paint the target then pin the target (pintar) to their friend's back without him knowing.
languages.question: What is the Spanish verb for "to paint"?

languages.mnemonic: The pair of golfers played a great round. They both finished 3 under par (par)
languages.question: What does "el par" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: A paper boat needs a paddle to propel (papel) it through the water.
languages.question: What does "el papel" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Papel is masculine, so it's el papel. Imagine an elephant made out of paper.
languages.question: What is "el papel"?

languages.mnemonic: The park had been covered in parquet (parque) flooring. Parque is masculine, so it's el parque. Imagine an elephant having a picnic in the park.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el parque"?

languages.mnemonic: Her favourite part was playing the part of an ape (parte).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "part"?

languages.mnemonic: The farmer wanted that particular (particular) bull.
languages.question: What is the word that describes something specific and distinct, like the farmer choosing a specific bull?

languages.mnemonic: The party is expensive to get into. The fee is estimated to be a (fiesta) weeks salary for me. Fiesta is feminine, so it's la fiesta. Imagine a ladies-only party that gets out of hand.
languages.question: What does "fiesta" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Can you pass these to the panda. He loves sardines (pasar) for lunch.
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "pasar" mean?

languages.mnemonic: He ran out of space to have his passport stamped as they passed through a port a day (pasaporte) on the cruise.
languages.question: What is "el pasaporte"?

languages.mnemonic: Some say, in the past, to pass exams was harder, but I don't (pasado) believe it.
languages.question: What does "el pasado" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: At twenty past six, I received an email (y), but it was just a big letter Y.
languages.question: What does "y" represent in telling time?

languages.mnemonic: I thought we were on the right path, but my cat had led me into the middle of nowhere (camino).
languages.question: What does "el camino" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Camino is masculine, so it's el camino. Imagine some elephants creating a path through the jungle.
languages.question: What does "el camino" mean?

languages.mnemonic: They said they liked his pattern ideas, but the artist wondered if he was being patronised (patrón).
languages.question: What is the meaning of "el patrón" in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: The pavement isn't the best place for a ceramics (acera) shop.
languages.question: What is "acera" in English?

languages.mnemonic: Acera is feminine so it's la acera. Imagine a lady with her stiletto heels stuck in the cracks of a pavement.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for pavement?

languages.mnemonic: I cannot believe that I had to pay my pa to guard (pagar) my dog.
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "pagar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: He hadn't made payment despite repeated reminders, so they took his pagoda (pago) away.
languages.question: What does the term "pago" mean?

languages.mnemonic: The peace sign we passed (paz) by is enormous.
languages.question: What does "la paz" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Paz is feminine, so it's la paz. Imagine a lady giving the peace sign.
languages.question: What does "la paz" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The pen released a plume of smoke, masking (pluma) his escape.
languages.question: What does "la pluma" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Pluma is feminine, so it's la pluma. Imagine a lady writing with a giant pen.
languages.question: What does "la pluma" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Using a pencil, she sketched the last piece (lápiz) of cake.
languages.question: What is "el lápiz" in English?

languages.mnemonic: Lápiz is masculine, so it's el lápiz. Imagine an elephant using a pencil.
languages.question: What is "el lápiz"?

languages.mnemonic: I cashed in my pension and bought the gold and diamond encrusted pen you can see on (pensión) the table.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "la pensión"?

languages.mnemonic: The people were surprised to see a hen take (gente) part in a marathon.
languages.question: What does the Spanish term "gente" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: I was buying some pepper and the pepper made me sneeze. I suddenly wanted a pee, but they wouldn't let me enter (pimienta).
languages.question: What is "la pimienta"?

languages.mnemonic: He won't eat it if it's not perfect. It has to be perfect toast (perfecto).
languages.question: What does "perfecto" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Perhaps you shouldn't have given your car keys to the ass (quizás).
languages.question: What does "quizás" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: A person who is unwelcome in a country is known as a persona (persona) non grata.
languages.question: What does the term "persona" refer to?

languages.mnemonic: Persona is feminine, so it's la persona. Imagine a lady who appears in person as well as on TV.
languages.question: What does the term "persona" refer to?

languages.mnemonic: Every photograph she took was on the same subject – they were all photos of raffia (fotografía), but they created a lot of interest at the gallery.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for photograph?

languages.mnemonic: A phrase can get you into a fracas if you say (frase) the wrong thing.
languages.question: What is the English translation of "frase"?

languages.mnemonic: The bull loves playing the piano (piano).
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el piano"?

languages.mnemonic: It was easy to pick the winner. She had record hair (recoger) length.
languages.question: What does the term "recoger" mean?

languages.mnemonic: Picture or imagine a hen (imagen).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "picture"?

languages.mnemonic: A piece of pizza was in her hair and so was salad (pieza).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for a piece?

languages.mnemonic: Pieza is feminine, so it's la pieza. Imagine a lady cutting a huge piece of cake for herself.
languages.question: What does "la pieza" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The pig serenaded my dad (cerda).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for pig?

languages.mnemonic: The Pink Panther is very upset. His prize roses are damaged (rosada) by the hailstones.
languages.question: What color does "el rosado/ la rosada" refer to?

languages.mnemonic: The only place the dog could go really loopy was in the garden (lugar).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "place"?

languages.mnemonic: The best place to see the lunar eclipse, I guarantee (lugar), is in the countryside.
languages.question: What is the English translation of the Spanish word "lugar"?

languages.mnemonic: The garden was very plain. It was a yard with no (llano) colour.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for a plain?

languages.mnemonic: She presented the business plan (plan) to the bull.
languages.question: What does "el plan" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Plan is masculine, so it's el plan. Imagine an elephant with a cunning plan.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for "plan"?

languages.mnemonic: On a distant planet, a plant ate an (planeta) alien.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el planeta"?

languages.mnemonic: The plant planted a (planta) beanstalk.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "la planta" en inglés?

languages.mnemonic: Don't play football with these hooligan gargoyles (jugar).
languages.question: What is the Spanish verb for "to play"?

languages.mnemonic: "Please" said the poor boy, "can I have an ice cream?" So his poor father (por favor) got him one, even though he couldn't really afford it.
languages.question: What is the English translation of "por favor"?

languages.mnemonic: The plural of bull is bulls.
languages.question: What term describes a word form used to indicate more than one of something?

languages.mnemonic: The poem calmed the mad (poema) lion.
languages.question: ¿Qué es un poema?

languages.definition: point (noun), as in the sharp end of a tool
languages.mnemonic: The point of the spoon dragged on the floor while being towed (punto).
languages.question: What is "punto" in the context of a sharp end of a tool?

languages.mnemonic: She couldn't help but point at the man playing the giant spoon guitar (puntar).
languages.question: What does "puntar" mean?

languages.mnemonic: The police did a polygraph test to see if a (policía) suspect was lying.
languages.question: What is "la policía"?

languages.mnemonic: The man was so poor. Not even his poems would buy bread (pobre) to feed his family.
languages.question: What does the Spanish word "pobre" mean?

languages.mnemonic: They decided to populate mars with polar bears. so they were bla sted (poblar) off in a rocket.
languages.question: What does "poblar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: In the port, park your boat where it won't be towed (puerto) away.
languages.question: What does "puerto" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The photographer took a great shot as the model posed on a pole in a sarong (posar).
languages.question: What does the verb "posar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The position I want you to be in is to pose in the sea so people can see you on (posición) the front of the magazine.
languages.question: ¿Cuál es la traducción de "la posición"?

languages.mnemonic: It's possible that your posture could be to blame (posible) for your backache.
languages.question: What is the English translation of the Spanish word "posible"?

languages.mnemonic: His new diet forbade him eating potatoes, so pa said ta-ta (patata) to them.
languages.question: What does "la patata" refer to in English?

languages.mnemonic: She gave the impression of great power as she stood on the podium and gave her address, but all she was talking to was thin air (poder)
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el poder"?

languages.mnemonic: They went out for a practice drive but she practically wrote the car (práctica) off!
languages.question: What is "la práctica" in English?

languages.mnemonic: Práctica is feminine, so it's la práctica. Imagine a lady who does piano practice every day.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "la práctica"?

languages.mnemonic: At precisely six o'clock an enormous spoon totally (en punto) destroyed my house.
languages.question: What does "en punto" mean in terms of time?

languages.mnemonic: Prepare to be amazed, the present from your pa is a rah-rah (preparar) skirt and he was wearing one too.
languages.question: What does "preparar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: This was not the present he was expecting. He was not ready for the gallows (regalo).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for a present or gift?

languages.mnemonic: Regalo is masculine, so it's el regalo. Imagine an elephant receiving a beautifully wrapped present.
languages.question: What does "regalo" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: There's no time like the present to give a presenta­tion (presente) on what climate change is going to do to us.
languages.question: What does "el presente" refer to in terms of time?

languages.mnemonic: Presente is masculine, so it's el presente. Imagine an elephant that likes to live for the present.
languages.question: What does "el presente" refer to in terms of time?

languages.mnemonic: The press were so busy they took on a new apprentice, sadly (prensa) he wasn't really interested in the work.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "la prensa"?

languages.mnemonic: She's pretty, but she's a bone eater (bonita).
languages.question: What does "bonito" (m) or "bonita" (f) mean in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: The price of her presents seemed over (precio) the top.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for "price"?

languages.mnemonic: Precio is masculine, so it's el precio. Imagine an elephant with a price tag.
languages.question: What does "precio" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Print the image of the priest holding a meerkat (imprimir) on my shirt.
languages.question: What does "imprimir" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The problem with these maths problems is my ma (problema) can't solve them.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "problem"?

languages.mnemonic: Problema is masculine, so it's el problema. Imagine an elephant trying to solve a problem.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for "problem"?

languages.mnemonic: We have to find a better process, the professor said so (proceso).
languages.question: ¿Qué significa la palabra 'proceso'?

languages.mnemonic: The product they produce is a hook to tow (producto) trucks.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for "product"?

languages.mnemonic: Proper doughnuts please, not just adequaate doughnuts (adecuardo).
languages.question: What does "adecuardo" mean?

languages.mnemonic: This is private property; it's inappropriate to peer at my dad (propiedad) through the window.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "property"?

languages.mnemonic: Propiedad is feminine, so it's la propiedad. Imagine a lady defending her property.
languages.question: What is the translation of "propiedad" in English?

languages.mnemonic: To protect her she had a fireproof suit but there was nothing to protect her hair (proteger).
languages.question: What does the verb "proteger" mean?

languages.mnemonic: To prove how brilliant she was, she demonstrated on the Stradivarius (demostrar) violin with her feet.
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "demostrar" mean?

languages.mnemonic: At this pub the tab can burn a (taberna) hole in your wallet.
languages.question: What is "la taberna" in English?

languages.mnemonic: Taberna is feminine, so it's la taberna. Imagine a lady riding a horse into a pub.
languages.question: What is "la taberna"?

languages.mnemonic: She had to pull my teeth out. "Hurrah" (tirar) she shouted as each one came out, while I shouted "Arhhh!".
languages.question: What does "tirar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The puppy escaped, and I had to catch it before it ran over the road (cachorro).
languages.question: What is "el cachorro" or "la cachorra" in English?

languages.mnemonic: The purple heather on the moor was changed by Leonardo (morado) because it was too much of a distraction.
languages.question: What is the English translation of "el morado / la morada"?

languages.mnemonic: They stole our wallet and purse and drove off in a car, terrorizing (cartera) people.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "la cartera"?

languages.mnemonic: Push the handle down on the toilet and that will empty the poop out, but press hard (empujar).
languages.question: What is the Spanish verb for "push"?

languages.mnemonic: Put the pony's hair (poner) into a ponytail.
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "poner" mean?

languages.mnemonic: A quarter of the quarantined toads (cuarto) escaped.
languages.question: What is the English translation of "el cuarto" when referring to a fraction?

languages.mnemonic: Cuarto is masculine, so it's el cuarto. Imagine an elephant cut into quarters.
languages.question: What does "el cuarto" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Their question for the construction boss was: "Pray, why did you fill our lagoon with tar?" (Pregunta).
languages.question: What is the English translation of "la pregunta"?

languages.mnemonic: He went as quick as lightning on the water rapids at (rápida) the amusement park.
languages.question: What is the meaning of "rápido" or "rápida"?

languages.mnemonic: She was quiet now because she had been given a tranquiliser (tranquilo).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for quiet?

languages.mnemonic: I haven't quite taken enough, the basket on the front of the tandem will take (bastante) more.
languages.question: What is the English translation of the Spanish word "bastante"?

languages.mnemonic: Entering the race with that car was an error (carrera) - it broke down on the first lap.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for "race"?

languages.mnemonic: Carrera is feminine, so it's la carrera. Imagine a lady painted on the side of a race car.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa la carrera en español?

languages.definition: el radio (m) - for the communication of programmes or messages; la radio (f) - for the set (device)
languages.mnemonic: I could hear the radio blasting out our new rap that we'd just finished in the studio (radio).
languages.question: What is the term "radio" used to refer to in Spanish, both as a communication medium and a device?

languages.mnemonic: Travelling by rail, the ferocious carnivore made a really (ferrocarril) short meal of all its fellow passengers.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "el ferrocarril"?

languages.mnemonic: It started to rain on Yogi Bear (llover) - he and Boo Boo were getting soaked in the Jellystone Park downpour.
languages.question: What is the Spanish verb used to describe when it rains?

languages.mnemonic: When the rain comes down heavily, you veer (lluvia) off the road in some places if you're not careful.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for rain?

languages.mnemonic: Lluvia is feminine, so it's la lluvia. Imagine that it's raining ladies.
languages.question: What does the Spanish word "lluvia" mean?

languages.mnemonic: Can you reach me a tin of tomato soup please? All the cans are (alcanzar) on the top shelf and I'm too short.
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "alcanzar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: I'll read you a bedtime story, just lay there (leer) and listen.
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "leer" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Ready, steady, go! The least obese (listo) was favourite to win the race.
languages.question: What does "listo/lista" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The reason they have come is to hear the rat sing a song (razón).
languages.question: What is the translation of "razón" in English?

languages.mnemonic: To receive his well-kept secret recipe for these beers (recibir) was an honour.
languages.question: What does "recibir" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The favourite recipe of this red setter (receta) is dog-friendly cake.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "recipe"?

languages.mnemonic: Receta is feminine, so it's la receta. Imagine a lady stealing a secret recipe.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for a recipe?

languages.mnemonic: The temperatures were the highest on record: there were warnings of strong sun rays causing heat stroke (registro).
languages.question: ¿Qué significa la palabra "registro" en español?

languages.mnemonic: From the red planet, they brought a rock home (rojo).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for the color red?

languages.mnemonic: In many a region of Spain, you can see a bull on the hillside.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa la región en español?

languages.mnemonic: I can't remember how to play the recorder (recordar) even after numerous lessons.
languages.question: What does the Spanish term "recordar" mean?

languages.mnemonic: We need to repair the red bus, and these parrots are (reparar) here to help.
languages.question: What does the verb "reparar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: "Repeat the routine!" - The rehearsal was so repetitious it left us in tears (repetir).
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "repetir" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: She didn't reply to my correspondence. How dare (responder) she.
languages.question: What does "responder" mean in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: It seemed to represent a load of black goo, said the critics – they didn't realise her painting was meant to represent tar (representar).
languages.question: What is the English translation of the Spanish term "representar"?

languages.mnemonic: I require you to be perfect. Any errors can wreck a career (requerir).
languages.question: What is the Spanish verb that means "require"?

languages.mnemonic: You can reserve a table, but you can't reser the whole bar (reservar).
languages.question: What does "reservar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The boss had gone to rest - people were calling him but all they got was his desk answer (descansar) phone.
languages.question: What does "descansar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The restaurant agreed we could rest our aunty (restaurante) there when she got tired during our shopping trip.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for "restaurant"?

languages.mnemonic: What a result! The red sultanas don't (resultado) put people off.
languages.question: What does "resultado" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Resultado is masculine, so it's el resultado. Imagine an elephant opening an envelope to see his exam result.
languages.question: What does "resultado" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Rice doesn't go with a roast (arroz) dinner.
languages.question: What is "el arroz"?

languages.mnemonic: He was so rich he could afford to have his walls recoated (rico) in real gold paint.
languages.question: What does "rico" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: I'd like to ride through the jungle just like monkeys and Tarzan (montar) do, swinging through the vines.
languages.question: What does "montar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: We turned right and came to a derelict house. It was clear we chose (derecho) the wrong direction.
languages.question: What does "derecho/derecha" mean in terms of direction?

languages.mnemonic: As the king of the jungle had a ring placed on his paw all the animals yodelled (anillo).
languages.question: What is "el anillo" in English?

languages.mnemonic: The river cruise company had been closed for years, but they decided to reopen (rio) it with a big fanfare when the river cruise became popular again.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "river"?

languages.mnemonic: The road was not suitable for the carriage, the terrain (carretera) was too rugged.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for "road"?

languages.mnemonic: Carretera is feminine, so it's la carretera. Imagine a lady lying in the middle of the road.
languages.question: What is meant by "la carretera"?

languages.mnemonic: A huge rock has rolled onto their caravan (roca) completely flattening it.
languages.question: What does "la roca" mean?

languages.mnemonic: This room has a bee tapestry that you can see on (habitación) every wall.
languages.question: What is "la habitación"?

languages.mnemonic: Habitación is feminine, so it's la habitación. Imagine a lady in a small room.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "la habitación"?

languages.mnemonic: Her roots were showing. It was rather easy (raíz) to find fault in this tree.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa "la raíz"?

languages.mnemonic: Raíz is feminine, so it's la raíz. Imagine a lady with roots instead of legs.
languages.question: What is the meaning of "la raíz"?

languages.mnemonic: The rope shows he must have climbed out the window. The question is, where has Dad gone?
languages.question: What is the English translation of the Spanish word "cuerda"?

languages.mnemonic: The rose rows a (rosa) boat along the river.
languages.question: What is "la rosa" in English?

languages.mnemonic: The round bouncing bombs were used in the raid on dams (redonda) in Germany during World War 2.
languages.question: What does "redondo (m)/redonda (f)" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: A row of eager children were waiting to feed the lambs (fila) at the farm zoo.
languages.question: What does the term "fila" mean?

languages.mnemonic: Rub your hands together if they're frozen, or you won't be able to play the guitar.
languages.question: What does "frotar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The pile of rubbish attracted bad super-rats (basura).
languages.question: What does "basura" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: They could see that the rule about each colour being refracted by a different amount was true when they aimed the ray at the glass (regla).
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for "rule"?

languages.mnemonic: Regla is feminine, so it's la regla. Imagine a lady who writes the rules.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for "rule"?

languages.mnemonic: Run – the cork is going to go off and fly through the air (correr).
languages.question: What does "correr" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: She was sad because she'd wanted the tree to stay (triste).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "sad"?

languages.mnemonic: Here you will be safe and secure from those goons, and rogues (seguro) who terrorise everyone in the neighbourhood.
languages.question: What does "seguro" or "segura" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The sail was just visible in the fog, so the captain rang a bell to announce (vela) the boats presence.
languages.question: What is "la vela" in English?

languages.mnemonic: She was addicted to salt - her mother told her off for getting saliva (sal) on the cellar.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for salt?

languages.mnemonic: I'm sick of using the same miserable mower (mismo) everyday!
languages.question: What does "mismo/misma" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Made out of sand, the children's brilliant art piece was a replica of a hyena (arena).
languages.question: What is "la arena"?

languages.mnemonic: I finally sat down on Saturday, but the kids sabotaged me with dough! (sábado).
languages.question: ¿Qué día de la semana es "el sábado"?

languages.mnemonic: Sauce was dripping off his suit – he hadn't realised while he was dancing the salsa (salsa).
languages.question: What does "la salsa" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: I competed in the 'sausage, salad and cheese' challenge (salchicha).
languages.question: What is the English translation of "la salchicha"?

languages.mnemonic: Don't say – there has been a death here (decir).
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "decir" mean?

languages.mnemonic: 'I say, have you been looking for me'? The death theory (decir) was ruled out by the police – the missing person appeared to be alive and well.
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "decir" mean?

languages.mnemonic: Don't be scared, but this animal pursues anyone that runs, so stand still and don't (asustado) move.
languages.question: What does "asustado" mean?

languages.mnemonic: The schedule says that at six o'clock, a rabbit trio (horario) are performing live.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for "schedule"?

languages.mnemonic: The school for the eskimos was a whaler (escuela) – a ship they had once used for hunting whales but which now had classrooms inside and a playground on the deck.
languages.question: What is "escuela" in English?

languages.mnemonic: In molecular science, to see anything, you must see it through a (ciencia) microscope.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for science?

languages.mnemonic: The sea was so calm they could see Mars (mar) reflected in it.
languages.question: What does the Spanish term "mar" mean?

languages.mnemonic: She wants a seafood feast when she marries on the coast (marisco).
languages.question: What does "el marisco" refer to?

languages.mnemonic: Each season, this establishment changes the decorations you see on (estación) it's walls.
languages.question: What is the meaning of "la estación"?

languages.mnemonic: This seat isn't great. I would prefer a seat away from these enormous toads (asiento).
languages.question: What does "asiento" mean?

languages.mnemonic: Let's sneak into the exclusive section, the security won't see us on (sección) the ceiling.
languages.question: What is the English translation of "sección"?

languages.mnemonic: Sección is feminine, so it's la sección. Imagine a whole section of a book dedicated to being a lady.
languages.question: What is the English translation of the Spanish word "sección"?

languages.mnemonic: I can't see over (ver) it!
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "ver" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: It seems that this parrot's hairstyle (parecer) has become very popular.
languages.question: What does "parecer" mean?

languages.mnemonic: That segment of the segregated men were in fact toads (segmento) in disguise.
languages.question: What is the meaning of "segmento"?

languages.mnemonic: Segmento is masculine, so it's el segmento. Imagine an elephant cut into segments.
languages.question: What is the meaning of the term "segmento" in English?

languages.mnemonic: I was sent to select several electric eels, but I could see only a narwhal (seleccionar).
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "seleccionar" mean?

languages.mnemonic: They couldn't sell Big Ben after it had become derelict (vender).
languages.question: What does the verb "vender" mean?

languages.mnemonic: Trying to send an envelope can be hard (enviar) when the post box keeps running away.
languages.question: What does the Spanish verb "enviar" mean?

languages.mnemonic: He had the good sense and judgement to tell the girl who he sees is oh (juicio) so beautiful to get out of trouble.
languages.question: ¿Qué significa el término "el juicio"?

languages.mnemonic: Juicio is masculine, so it's el juicio. Imagine an elephant using good common sense.
languages.question: What does "el juicio" refer to in terms of decision-making?

languages.mnemonic: The lengthy sentence needed rewriting as only a fraction of words the secretary (frase) used were needed.
languages.question: What is "la frase" in English?

languages.mnemonic: We had to separate the septuplets at the party - they were arguing (separar) over who should blow out the candles.
languages.question: ¿Cómo se dice "separate" en español?

languages.mnemonic: The septic (tank) team member (September) needed a good bath, so it was a really septic embrace (septiembre) when she gave the customer a big hug.
languages.question: What is the English translation of "septiembre"?

languages.mnemonic: They serve it in a ceramic beer (servir) mug.
languages.question: What does the verb "servir" mean?

languages.mnemonic: Her set of golf clubs was consumed by the typhoon and were totally (conjunto) lost.
languages.question: What does "conjunto" mean in English when used as a noun?

languages.mnemonic: The Seven Dwarves went off to work every day and the idea of a siesta never tempted (siete) them.
languages.question: What does the Spanish word "siete" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Glam rock started in about Nineteen-Seventy, but you wouldn't find ABBA - famous for their hits in the Seventies - setting a tent up (setenta) once they made the big time.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for seventy?

languages.mnemonic: There were several barriers (varias) to get over.
languages.question: What does the Spanish term "varios (m)/ varias (f)" mean?

languages.mnemonic: She moved into the shade to practise her gymnastics. As she did a somersault, her bra (sombre) flew off.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for "shade"?

languages.mnemonic: The shape of the biscuits formed a map (forma) of the world.
languages.question: What is the definition of "forma"?

languages.mnemonic: He offered to share some champagne from the glove compartment, but she ran away and he was left in tears (compartir).
languages.question: What does the Spanish word "compartir" mean?

languages.mnemonic: The shark's teeth were beautiful, but it would be wrong (tiburón) to get too close.
languages.question: What does "tiburón" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: As it's incredibly sharp, a goose shouldn't be trusted with a dagger (aguda).
languages.question: What does "agudo" or "aguda" mean in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: She's Luke Skywalker's sister, Princess Leia (ella).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "she"?

languages.mnemonic: This sheep wears only the best hats (oveja).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for sheep?

languages.mnemonic: This sheet of paper says that all oats are half (hoja) price.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "sheet"?

languages.mnemonic: Hoja is feminine, so it's la hoja. Imagine a lady printed on a sheet of paper.
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for a sheet?

languages.mnemonic: The shine of the lightsaber meant the battle was brief. Yoda (brillo) quickly defeated the droids.
languages.question: What does "el brillo" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: They couldn't let him on to the ship because the barco (barco) on his ticket was wrong.
languages.question: What is "el barco"?

languages.mnemonic: It matched the colour of my shirt when the chameleon sat (camisa) on it.
languages.question: What is "la camisa" in English?

languages.mnemonic: The shoe didn't hide my sad pa's toe (zapato).
languages.question: What is "el zapato" in English?

languages.mnemonic: After a trip to the shop, she had a cup of tea to end her (tienda) outing.
languages.question: What is "la tienda" in English?

languages.mnemonic: I rarely catch a fish on the shore – I only reel in yaks.
languages.question: What does "la orilla" refer to in English?

languages.mnemonic: She was so short, the little ballerina had (baja) to stand on her tip toes to look taller.
languages.question: What does "bajo (m)/ baja (f)" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: After a short while, the courts opinion (corto) was given in favour of the accused and he was released.
languages.question: What does "corto (m)/corta (f)" mean in terms of length of time?

languages.mnemonic: She put her shoulder into throwing the omelette hard but it broke (hombro) the ceiling.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for "shoulder"?

languages.mnemonic: You will have to shout to greet Tarzan (gritar) in the jungle - it's quite noisy in there.
languages.question: What does the word "gritar" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Using a shovel, I tried to clear the path to the lavatory (pala).
languages.question: What is "la pala" in English?

languages.mnemonic: Show me your most successful strategies (mostrar) for stopping hair loss.
languages.question: What is the Spanish verb for "to show"?

languages.mnemonic: They don't like it, but in the shower, I do chat (ducha) to strangers a lot.
languages.question: What is "la ducha" in Spanish?

languages.mnemonic: In the Cuban hotel room, there was a notice on the shower saying: "Please don't do the cha cha (ducha) in here". But some guests took no notice...
languages.question: What is a "ducha" in a bathroom?

languages.mnemonic: "I'm shy. You can teach me, but don't (tímido) shout."
languages.question: What is the English translation of "tímido"?

languages.mnemonic: He jumped to the side just before the ladder fell over (lado).
languages.question: What does "el lado" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: What a marvellous sight, look at those wonderful vistas (vista).
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for sight, often used to describe a scenic view?

languages.mnemonic: Vista is feminine, so it's la vista. Imagine a lady shaped island, it's quite a sight!
languages.question: What does "la vista" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: The bride agreed to sign the prenuptial agreement to allay the groom's fear the marriage (firmar) was for money, not love.
languages.question: What does "firmar" mean in the context of a document?

languages.mnemonic: Her signature was not clear – she needed a firmer (firma) grip on the pen to make it visible.
languages.question: What is the term for a person's handwritten name or mark, often required on official documents, also known as "firma"?

languages.mnemonic: There was complete silence when they were asked if they wanted to see the full-length scenes of his boring holiday video (silencio)
languages.question: What is the Spanish term for silence?

languages.mnemonic: It was silly to give a gin and tonic to the toad (tonto).
languages.question: What does "tonto" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Don't be silly Tonto (tonto), said the Lone Ranger.
languages.question: What does "tonto" mean in English?

languages.mnemonic: Her meals were brought to her on a silver platter (plata).
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for silver?

languages.mnemonic: Plata is feminine, so it's la plata. Imagine a lady made of silver.
languages.question: What is the Spanish word for silver?

languages.mnemonic: The two bulls were similar (similar).
languages.question: What is a way to describe objects that resemble each other?
